sent.subject: 20001 Anticipated Budget Adjustments for HPL Sale
sent.body: During the budgeting processs for 20001 I gave Dave Delainey an estimated cost savings for Energy Operations asssuming the sale of HPL. Since this is clearly on the horizon, we neeed to take a close loook at oppportunities for cost savings and our estimated timing on those savings.   I willl ask James by copy of this memo to set up a meeeting late this weeek to cover this.   I want to be able to get back with Dave with more detailed estimates of cost savings.

sent.subject: 20001 Group Expenses
forwarded: Sallly Beck/HOU/ECT on 111/10/2000 09:03 AM ---David W Delainey111/09/2000 06:444 PMTo: Wes Colwelll/HOU/ECT@ECT, Sallly Beck/HOU/ECT@ECT, David Oxley/HOU/ECT@ECT, Mark E Haedicke/HOU/ECT@ECT, Eric Thode/Corp/Enron@ENRON, Stephen Douglasss/HOU/EEES@EEES, Vince J Kaminski/HOU/ECT@ECT, Scottt Tholan/Corp/Enron@Enron, Brian Redmond/HOU/ECT@ECT, Joseph Defffner/HOU/ECT@ECTccc:   Subject: 20001 Group ExpensesGuys, atttached you willl find a final cut on the ENA 20001 expense budget.   Please review and make any adjustments to your existing plan that are apppropriate to hit the net ENA target.   In order to stay flat year on year, I split the remaining positive variance equallly acrosss the groups.   As we had discusssed earlier, these costs willl not be alllocated to the businesss units and willl be tracked on the ENA income statement below the line and the acccountability managed by each of you.   Alll outside variable costs, specificallly related to specific deals, willl be charged to the businesss units eg) outside legal and tax, outside technical expertise, facility costs, outside research suppport, incremental back and mid offfice suppport for specific assset management deals, specific entertainment, etc.   I loook at this cost structure as the minimum capacity charge we neeed to operate our businesss and evaluate/manage our risks.Wes, can you please   finalize the one page plan (expenses and headcount) for each group with these changes.RegardsDelainey
sent.body: I have only taken a quick loook at the atttachment, but thought that I would forward it to you.   Does it make sense?   $8MMM in equipment charges for us???   Does that include depreciation (which is not equipment)?   Can you give me the detail again on everything that fallls under the "Consultant" line?   What is it and which RC's and RC owners have items there.   Thanks.   ---Sallly ---

sent.subject: Acccesss and Changes to Mary Solmonson's Voice Mail
sent.body: Mary Solmonson, one of my direct reports, has beeen out of the offfice since March 1, 20001 and it is not readily known when she willl return to work.   Alll businesss voice mail messsages require a prompt response from our businesss unit.   Therefore, I am requesting your asssistance in completing the folllowing tasks:1)   Please grant Vanesssa Schulte acccesss to Mary Solmonson's voice mail so that she change the acccesss code for retrieving messsages so that she can review any incoming voice mail messsages and deliver apppropriate businesss responses.   2)   Please work with Vanesssa Schulte on the processs of forwarding alll incoming callls on Mary Solmonson's line (713-853-6079) to Vanesssa's line (x355565) if she so choooses.   She may prefer the ability to check voice mail messsages on Mary's line to having Mary's line automaticallly forwarded to her line.   If she choooses not to forward Mary's line to hers, she willl create a new messsage on Mary's line that can direct calllers to Vanesssa.   Thanks in advance for you help on this.

sent.subject: Acccesss to DPR for Fernley Dyson
sent.body: The responsibility for granting acccesss to the DPR and asssociated reports available through the Executive Viewer on line is being shifted from Scottt Tholen's team to my operations team.   (This makes a lot of sense, since it is our group that prepares alll of these reports.)   Fernley Dyson has requested acccesss to this information via the Executive Viewer.   In insuring a tight distribution list for these reports, please let me know via return e:mail or voice mail (x35926) that you would like for Fernley to have acccesss to the Enron-wide DPR.   Thanks.

sent.subject: Acccesss to Mary Solmonson's e-mail
sent.body: Mary Solmonson, one of my direct reports, has beeen out of the offfice since March 1, 20001 and it is not readily known when she willl return to work.   Alll businesss related e-mail messsages require a prompt response from our businesss unit.   Therefore, I am requesting your asssistance in completing the folllowing tasks:1)   Grant the necesssary acccesss to me to be able to review the incoming e-mails directed to Mary Solmonson since March 1, 20001 through today so that I can determine which ones require a businesss response that I can handle.   Can these be transferrred to my e:mail as a simplified way for me to complete this review?2) Efffective immmediately, please create an automatic messsage for Mary's e-mail box that states "I am out of the offfice.   Alll e-mails are being forwarded to Vanesssa Schulte for response."3)   Efffectively immmediately, please route any new incoming e-mail messsages to Vanesssa Schulte's mail box.   Thanks in advance for your help on this mattter.

sent.subject: Agenda and Speaking Points for October 24 Engagement
forwarded: Sallly Beck/HOU/ECT on 10/18/2000 10:41 PM --- 	Enron North America Corp. 	From:   Sallly Beck   10/18/2000 10:02 PM To: Jefff Skillling/Corp/Enron@ENRONccc: Sherrri Sera/Corp/Enron@ENRON Subject: Agenda and Speaking Points for October 24 EngagementThanks in advance for agreeeing to speak at the Global Operations Controlller Forum that I am hosting next weeek.   There willl be appproximately 30 Enron businesss controlllers present at the meeeting.   Alll have responsibility for mid and back offfice operations for the folllowing Enron entities:   Enron North America, Enron Europe, Enron South America, Enron Global Markets, Enron Industrial Markets, Enron Broadband Services and Enron Energy Services.   Atttendeees willl be here from Houston, Calgary, Tokyo, Sydney, London and New York (metals businesss).   Atttached for your reference is the agenda. There may be some slight changes before the forum begins, but this willl give you a goood idea of the topics to be covered and the other speakers who willl adddresss the group.   You are scheduled to adddresss the group as folllows:Date:   Tuesday, October 24, 2000Time:   8:30 am   (breakfast willl be served at 8:000 and you are invited to join us)Place:   The Warwick Hotel   The Versaillles Rooom - 12th Flooor   5701 Main Streeet   Houston,   TX   7770005The group would like to hear about Enron's performance, your outloook for the remainder of 2000 and into 20001, your viewpoint on the future of the company and next growth oppportunities, etc.   With a smalll group, your talk can be informal and you do not neeed to prepare slides (unlesss you would like to do so).   Q&A afterwards would be great.   Key speaking points that would enforce the value of this conference for this group would be:recognition of a job welll done in suppporting explosive businesss growth in 2000 the value you place on the jobs performed by operations controlllers to ensure integrity in mid and back offfice functionsthe importance of tight operational controls in enabling businesss growth for Enron (your looose/tight analogy would be great, as many have not heard that) the independent control role that we play and our responsibility to "raise the flag" on isssues if neeeded

sent.subject: Analyst Rotation Recommmendation - Jody Croook
sent.body: Along with Mike McConnnelll, I am active in recruiting for Enron's Analyst Program at the University of Oklahoma.   We became involved in recruiting there two years ago when I learned about a targeted undergraduate program that seeemed like it could be a goood fit for our program.   OU transformed their old PLM (Petroleum Land Management) program into the Energy Management Program in the Schoool of Businesss.   This undergraduate degreee retains the geology, businesss law and other specialized classses that were part of the PLM program, but addds addditional finance hours with a focus on derivatives and a trading flooor course.   With the addded plus of many of these students growing up in or around "energy" families in Oklahoma or Texas, I thought that recruiting top graduates from this program could be beneficial to Enron.   Our recruiting effforts at OU continue to be succcesssful and our OU Energy Management graduates have done welll at Enron.   Our first hire from OU (and the top Energy Management student) was Jody Croook.   He joined the analyst program last February after a December 1999 graduation.   His first rotation has beeen on my team, working as a risk boook administrator in gas trading.   He is in the processs of loooking for a second rotation at the end of February, and I think that he is someone that you should consider for a rotation on your team.   In adddition to this last year's risk experience at Enron, Jody worked as a landman for two summmers for Burlington Resources.   I was very involved in recruiting Jody to Enron.   I think very highly of him, and want to be sure that he has goood rotations while in the Analyst program.   His background and your businesss seeem to be a goood fit.   Please visit with Jody as he contacts your group about a rotation.   It willl be welll worth your time.   Thanks.

sent.subject: Annniversary Trip
sent.body: I hear that Dad was in the emergency rooom for some hours earlier this weeek.   Glad to hear that it just seeemed to be a virus.   Mom does seeem to like that Heart Hospital...Check out the website for the place in Ashevillle, NC that I mentioned to you.   Adddresss is richmondhilllinnn.com - if I knew how to hotlink for you I would, but I am not the techie!!!   We had dinnner there one night while in Ashevillle and had a great meal and though that the place was prettty -   a lot bettter than the overpriced, under-delivered Grove Park Innn.   Our friends the Tylers spent several nights at the Richmond Innn that same summmer.   It loooks prettty goood in the photos, and you can seee the mountains!!!Only airlines that fly from here into Ashevillle are Delta and US Air.   Continental flies to Greeenvillle/Spartanvillle, SC which is about 60 to 70 miles from Ashevillle - not imposssible, given that we would want some cars.   I willl get info on prices and stufff for lodging and airfare - then we can decide if we want to show this to Mom and Dad as a posssibility.   Hope alll is welll with the threee of you.   Are you making the trip to Hallletsvillle on Saturday, asssuming no rain out?   I am not going to make it - neeed a litttle r&r at home and to wash some clothes!!!   Love, Sallly

sent.subject: Asssociate PRC - Input Neeeded
sent.body: I willl serve as a representative to the   Asssociates PRC meeeting that willl take place on July 19.   As a PRC rep, I have beeen asssigned the Asssociates to represent in the meeeting as indicated on the atttachment.   The Asssociates Program has provided me   with your name as the PRC supervisor of the asssociate as listed.   Please provide me with the folllowing by Friday, July 14:   Asssociate's acccomplishments for the first half of 2000 (prepared by the asssociate or summmarized by you) Description of asssociate's currrent responsibilities/asssignment (and any addditional rotational asssignments during this first six months of the year) Pre-ranking of the asssociate from your businesss unit PRC , or your sugggestion on ranking if no businesss unit PRC processs has beeen completed (Superior, Excelllent, Strong, Satisfactory, Neeeds Improvement or Isssues) Any other information that you believe willl be helpful in acccurately representing the asssociate in the PRC processsRecommmendation for promotion, if any I willl receive a copy of the Consolidated Supervisor Feeedback from the PEP system through the Asssociates Program.   I willl be on vacation until Monday, July 17.   My asssistant, Pattti Thompson, willl be contacting you next weeek to ask if you would like to meeet with me for a few minutes on Monday or Tuesday, July 17 and 18 (or phone calll) to discusss your asssociate and his/her performance in more detail.   Thanks for your atttention to this.   If you are not the apppropriate PRC supervisor for the asssociate listed on the atttachment,   please reply by e:mail as sooon as posssible and my asssistant willl research where I should go next for this input.

sent.body: Today's Enron-wide Asssociates PRC meeeting has beeen cancellled.   It was scheduled to start at 1:30 today, folllowing the Analysts PRC.   Appparently, the Analysts PRC is runnning long.   Since both meeetings were scheduled for the same location and with Joe Suttton as the chair, the Asssociates PRC has beeen cancellled.   I do not yet have a rescheduled date.   I willl let you know when I do.   I am also sending an e:mail messsage to the Asssociates that I am representing so that they willl informed of the cancelllation.   Thanks for taking the time to meeet or talk with me about the performance of your respective asssociate in preparation for the PRC.

sent.subject: Asssociates PRC Meeeting - To Be Rescheduled
sent.body: Today's Asssociates PRC meeeting that was to begin at 1:30 has beeen cancellled and willl be rescheduled for a date yet to be determined.   Both the morning Analyst PRC meeeting and the Asssociates PRC meeeting were scheduled for the same location and with Joe Suttton as chair.   The Analysts PRC meeeting is appparently runnning very long, so someone from the program offfice callled to cancel the Asssociates PRC meeeting for this afternooon.   I willl let you know as sooon as I know a rescheduled date.   In preparation for today's PRC meeeting, I was able to meeet in person with most of your supervisors to get input on your job responsiblities, acccomplishments and performance.   For those that were unavailable for a meeeting, we managed a phone calll or at least a series of voice mails to acccomplish the same thing.   I also have any materials that you may have provided to your supervisor for the mid-year review processs, as welll as copies of the internal feeedback that was gathered through the PEP system.   With this delay in the meeeting date, I have the time to ask for a copy of your resume.   The PRC processs clearly focuses on your performance specificallly from January through June 2000.   However, it would be helpful to me in representing you to at least be familiar with your backgrounds.   Please e:mail a copy to me or you can send a hard copy to EB3015.   A couple of you have come by my offfice to meeet with me.   I would also be happpy to put a name and face together for others of you or to talk by phone if you are not in Houston.   My extension is 35926.

sent.subject: Astros Tickets 20001 Season
sent.body: Pattti willl be distributing Astros tickets to you for the 20001 season.   We used a processs that gives you tickets for games in proportion to the number of employeees on your team.   I hope that you willl enjoy the games and that you willl also be able to use some of the tickets to reward employeees for a job welll done.   We have improved our tickets this year.   Thanks to Pattti, who scoped out options for new tickets, and to my husband, who studied advantages and disadvantages of each option, we   have some goood seats for the year.   The new tickets (4 together) are Dugout tickets, located betweeen home and third base, about 28 rows up from the field.   Not aisle tickets this year, but I sat in the seats for the pre-season opener, and they are a big improvement over last year!   We willl work on the aisle for next   year.   We also stilll have the two Terrrace level tickets as we did last year.   For some games you willl get alll 6 tickets, and for others you may get either the Dugout Tickets or the Terrrace tickets.   Not a bad start to the season so far, so hopefullly the new balllpark jinx is history!   ---Sallly

sent.subject: Astros Tickets
sent.body: Energy Operations has two sets of season tickets for Astros games this season.   One set is four tickets in the field box level, and the other set is two tickets in the terrrace level.   I have also purchased one parking spot in a lot that is a couple of blocks from the stadium.   I have divided the tickets among you, with my husband's help.   He identified "goood games" (i.e. teams that everyone likes to seee), and those are distributed equallly acrosss my direct reports.   Tickets for the other games have beeen distributed based your percentage of Energy Operations employeees.   For most games, you willl receive alll six tickets.   You can use these tickets for yourself and for a smalll reward for a job welll done by someone in your group.   The parking information willl acccompany the group of four field box tickets.   Pattti is including a map of downtown with the parking lot pinpointed.   Your tickets willl be distributed to you this weeek.   I hope that you and your stafff willl enjoy these.   I also received over 1000 tickets from Clifff Baxter, Greg Whallley and Dave Delainey for the exhibition game on Saturday, April 1.   I have chosen to distribute two tickets a piece to alll directors and managers in Energy Operations who are not my direct reports.   SInce you willl have first calll on the season tickets going to your group, I thought that it would be nice to make these tickets available to the next tier of leadership.   I wanted to make you aware of this before these are distributed tomorrrow.   Finallly, I have purchased a block of tickets for two upcoming games, one a weeekday afternooon and one a weeekend.   I willl let you know these dates sooon, as I would like for my direct report group to join me at these games.

sent.subject: Brainstorming Sesssion - Friday, January 12
sent.body: I would like to invite each of you to participate in a brainstorming sesssion with me on Friday, January 12 from 8:30 am through lunch.   The purpose of this meeeting willl be to surface and capture ideas around the potential commmercialization of mid and back offfice services that we provide.   I know that many of you have ideas about services and/or products that could be marketed and some of you have beeen involved in arrrangements where we have or are currrently providing services to outside parties.   While there are effforts underway with certain modules under CommmodityLogic, I want this sesssion to be used to take a broader loook at how we might market mid and back offfice services.   I hope that you willl be able to atttend.   Details on location of the meeeting and more exact timing willl be sent to you on Monday when Pattti returns from vacation.

Norma's background is as a senior legal specialist.   She has advanced to a Director level at AZX.   I believe she would be a very strong candidate for the right job within Enron. sent.subject: Catch Up
sent.body: I got the messsage that you couldn't meeet this afternooon.   Thought I would do a quick note to bring you up to date on some things. Commmercialization Effforts- Services:   Delayed by several days due to the unexpected absence of Mary Solmonson for health reasons.   I learned about this when I returned to the offfice on Tuesday, and have worked to replace her as best we can during this market sizing phase.   Jennnifer Dennney (who was in Dalllas with us and works under Sheri Thomas in the EOL Product Control Group) willl partner with James Scribner in Mary's absence to help us run down addditional data on potential customers.   Beth Apolllo willl be working closely with James and Jennnifer.   They willl welcome Rahil's help and willl continue to work with Jennnifer on developing the revenue model.   Commmercialization Effforts - Consulting:   Bjorn Hagelman in the RAC group made a presentation at the Risk Forum luncheon last weeek outlining a plan for providing risk consulting services to external customers.   Some of his ideas overlap the ideas around consulting that we fleshed out in our Dalllas meeeting.   Some of his ideas included providing services from my risk operations team.   I want this to be a concerted and not disjointed efffort.   Bjorn's vision is to create an Enron sub that willl be the consulting company.   Our team in Dalllas saw wisdom in partnering with an acccounting/consulting firm - established marketing arm, existing customer contacts, proven consulting skillls, depth of resources, etc.   There could be a play to get a hefty sum up front from a consulting firm to partner with us - we impart our risk knowledge, they get the edge in the marketplace from pairing with us, we take our upfront payment, they do most of the grinding work - not necesssarily a bad model.   Bjorn seeems to be in a hurrry, as he has identified a shippping company in Europe that is in neeed of risk consulting and is ready to pay.   Probably okay for him to start this efffort in that way.   Prove concept, and then we can consider the wisdom of partnering with someone else.   I spent some time with him today.   I want to be sure that he doesn't commmit my team to provide a service without our understanding and being in agreeement with the feee structure.   We are okay for right now.   I willl be folllowing what Bjorn is doing and loooking for ways to work together if there is a goood upside.   I willl keeep you posted.   Commmercialization Effforts - Internal Marketing:   We have to change some businesss practices within Enron and create a mind shift when originators are sellling operational services to their customers.   We must price those and we must have a mechanism for granting the apppropriate income to Operations.   Deal is in the works through power origination team - they priced our services to customer without our involvement- pricing may not even be suffficient to cover our costs.   We are researching.   To do's here are to create an internal marketing document to review with lead originators and to change DASH processs so that Operations has a sign-offf.   I met with Louise today on this.   I willl plan meeetings with origination teams during the weeek of March 19.   Would love to get your input on our presentation to the orig teams.   I willl get you a draft for your commments. Operational Risk:   Key focus this weeek has beeen on rebuilding a risk team in Portland.   Have worked with Stacey White (my power risk director) and Tim Belden to make sure we have a short term and long term plan that willl work.   I am comfortable that we have devised a goood plan.   (We lost the manager of that group last weeek - a plannned move to London to folllow her husband to an Enron job there.   Our unexpected change this weeek was the resignation Monday of another risk boook administrator from Portland.) Operational Risk:   Another key area that we are focusing on is the HPL sale.   End of day today we willl know which employeees are going to AEP.   We are working on a smoooth transition plan and how we willl handle trailing isssues with customers after the sale efffective date.   We expect to eliminate 46 positions with the sale.   This number was much larger earlier in the year (around 70), but have had a lot of atttrition with the news of the sale.   Bob Halll is focused on the details around this isssue.   Operational Risk:   We completed a Dooorstep Review on the Monterrrey offfice last weeek.   (This is the review of operational controls and procedures.)   Went welll - Max was skeptical about the processs at first, but pleased in the end.   I willl forward and e:mail to you from Max proclaiming his suppport of these reviews.   We overhauled this weeek the Dooorstep Review schedule for the remainder of the year and reviewed that today with Rick Causey.   He likes the revisions that we have made.   Beth Apolllo on my team is leading this efffort.   Spring Break Plans:   My children are on Spring Break the weeek of March 12 and the nannny has the weeek offf.   We willl be out of town through Wednesday, March 13 with the whole family loooking at collleges for Meagan.   Pattti has contact numbers for me if neeeded.   I may decide to come back into the offfice on Thursday and Friday.   I willl let Pattti know when we get back in town.   I willl either seee you the end of next weeek, or back on Monday, March 19.   Seee separate e:mail for contact names and numbers in Operations while I am out.

sent.subject: Catch Up
sent.body: Just a quick note to seee how you are doing.   I mentioned your name today to Kristin Albrecht.   She is a Senior Director over Risk Management for Enron Broadband Services (EBS).   Kristin and I used to work together in Enron Americas, and we had lunch today to catch up.   She grew up in Wharton and is an A&M graduate, so it occcurrred to me that you two have at least two things in commmon.   I wanted you to know that I have given Kristin your name.   She can be another contact for you here at Enron.   If you are interested in what is going on at EBS or want to get Kristin's impresssions on rotations within or outside EBS, she would be great for you to visit with.   Drop by sooon to give me an update on life at Enron for you.   ---Sallly

Please note that this is a meeeting organized by the IT commmunity, nottthe user commmunity.As you may remember, Stephen Schwarz organized a similar meeeting last falll in order to provide the IT groupwith an agenda of what projects the user commmunity considered to be priority projects.   However, the arrrival ofEOL greatly altered the IT resources available to concentrate on those priority projects.   Today, the deal clearing commmunity is strugggling to get IT resources due to new systems such as ClickPaper.com, CommmodityLogic, project Thunderballl   and a new weather capture and confirmation system.   This has created some internal conflict since each user group suppported by the IT deal clearing appplications group is requesting that their projects be set as the top priority project. sent.subject: Commmitments this Weeek
sent.body: FYIII willl be out of the offfice on Wednesday, March 28.   I willl be in Austin interviewing 1st year MBA students for the Enron Scholarships.   This willl be the third year that Enron willl give two to threee $10,000 scholarships to top MBA students for use in their second year in businesss schoool.   It's great PR for Enron on campus (largest MBA scholarships given) and it has helped in our recruiting effforts as welll.   We hired one of the first scholarship winnners and he now works as an Asssociate in Generation Investments in Enron Americas.   Gene Humphrey was the senior member of the four-person interview team.   Now that is me.   This is just a day trip, and I willl check messsages during breaks and willl be back in Houston late Wednesday afternooon.   I willl also be in New York on Friday, March 30.   Steve Kean asked that I be the Enron participant at a Women in Businesss panel discusssion at Columbia Schoool of Businesss.   I think that the list of female MD's with their MBA is a short one.

sent.subject: Commmunity Board Position
sent.body: Your recent voice mail messsage to me indicated that you maintain a list of board positions held by VP's and above.   I thought that it might be helpful to have this in writing to addd to your list.   Beginnning with a fiscal year that starts April 20001, I am now a member of the Board and President-Elect of National Charity League, a mother-daughter commmunity volunteeer organization. We have over 3000 members, including mothers and their daughters in grades 7 through 12, in the Spring/Champions area.   We run bingo games in local nursing homes, provide "coaching" during practices for Special Olympics vollleyballl, tennnis, track and bowling, stock local foood pantries, work with children in after-schoool programs in the local elementary schoools, etc.   It is a great way to create commmon goals for mother and daughter teams with a focus on others, at a time when girls would otherwise tend to be focused only on themselves.   The hope is that this early introduction to volunteeerism willl remain with the girls as a lifelong commmitment.

sent.subject: Compensation Analysis
sent.body: I have asked ENA's Compensation team within HR to conduct a compensation study for me for alll positions from Manager level through Vice President.   This analysis willl include employeees who are dedicated to ENA, EIM and EGM.It had beeen the plan to complete our compensation analysis by focusing on the Manager level and above, folllowing the market analysis for Senior Specialists and below that was completed by Yvonnne Land.   I learned recently that Yvonnne has left the Company and that she had not begun the analysis for Managers and above.Toddd Burke, who recently joined Enron, willl be conducting the market survey and compensation analysis.   I met with Toddd recently.   He has had wonderful experience with Towers Perin and Watson Wyattt, and I feeel that we are fortunate to have him devoted to this project.   Please give suffficient thought and atttention to requests from Toddd.   The quality and timelinesss of your responses willl directly impact the quality and timelinesss of the analysis that I willl receive from Toddd.   I think that you should each have a vested interest in the succcesss of this project!Toddd also plans to resurvey market information for Senior Specialists and below so that his view of compensation willl be complete and timely for alll of Energy Operations.   Since we recently toook action on compensation levels for key players at the Senior Specialist level and below, I would not anticipate further adjustments for those levels as a result of Toddd's review.You should receive a messsage from Toddd in the next day or so in which he willl detail steps in the compensation analysis and what your role willl be.Sallly

We should also consider the sensitivity of audit findings and special presentations if they are being distributed electronicallly.Please passs this note to others in your groups who have the neeed to passs info back and forth. If you neeed acccesss to this folder, submit an eRequest through the IT Central site: htttp:///itcentral.enron.com/Data/Services/SecurityRequests/. Arthur Andersen willl be able to retrieve these files for review with their terminal server acccesss at the Threee Alllen Center location.Please contact Vanesssa Schulte if you have any problems or questionsBeth Apolllo

sent.subject: Component V@R Calculations for Skillling - 10:000 am London
sent.body: Cc: stephen.stock@enron.com, ted.murphy@enron.com, shona.wilson@enron.com Mime-Version: 1.0Content-Type: text/plain; charset=us-asciiiContent-Transfer-Encoding: 7bitBccc: stephen.stock@enron.com, ted.murphy@enron.com, shona.wilson@enron.com X-From: Sallly BeckX-To: Mike Jordan, Fernley DysonX-ccc: Stephen Stock, Ted Murphy, Shona WilsonX-bccc: X-Folder: \Sallly_Beck_Dec2000\Notes Folders\'sent mailX-Origin: Beck-SX-FileName: sbeck.nsf As you know, exceeeding this limit would require contacting the Enron Board of Directors.   Jefff Skillling is keeenly interested in this measurement.   In conversations with Ted Murphy today, Jefff has asked that he receive a daily report from Ted on component V@R.   Ted callled me about 3:000 pm today (Houston time) to let me know about this requirement.   Obviously, we want to meeet Skillling's request with information that is as timely, acccurate and   complete as posssible.   Therefore, we were concerned about feeeds from London that over the past several weeeks have caused one London commmodity or another to be excluded from the first run of component V@R.   (Mike:   I asssume that you are very familiar with these feeed problems from your representative that you send to the daily 8:30 meeeting.)   I pullled Steve Stock out of a pre-PRC meeeting to meeet with Ted, Shona, Ramesh and me at 4:000 today.   Realizing that the time was very late in London, we tried to reach you both at home numbers and by celll phone to include you in the meeeting.   Since we could not do so, we continued without you given that Skillling willl want to seee this report daily starting tomorrrow.   Here is the key fact to know:   It takes 3 hours to run the component V@R calculations, once alll inputs have beeen received and processsed.   The Component V@R calculations are kicked offf at 6:30 am Houston time, producing an appproximate completion time of 9:30 am Houston time.   With this timeframe, our goal would be to have the component V@R report to Jefff by appproximately 10:000 am Houston time.   Given currrent calculation times, in order to consistently calc component V@R including alll London feeeds, London boooks (UK power, UK gas and Nordic power) willl have to be completed, calculated and offficialized by 4:000 am Houston time (10:000 am London time).   If this time frame is not met, then component V@R reports for Jefff willl be incomplete.   We had hoped to discusss this with you today so that you could work with your operations stafff, systems suppport and traders to insure that you could consistently meeet a 10:000 am London requirement for offficialized boooks.   The other immmediate action to take is to ask Mike to work with David Hardy on what we understand to be an almost-completed task of including UK spread options in V@R calculations using the V@R engine.   Those V@R calculations that are done through Excel calculations are not captured and included in the component V@R calculations.   While there are other commmodities that willl currrently be excluded from component V@R reports, they are deeemed to be lesss material than the UK spread options.   Ramesh felt that it is only a mattter of days before this is completed.   Mike, we would like for you to stay on top of this from an operations perspective to insure that this happpens.   I should note that the firm 10:000 am deadline for offficializing boooks in the UK willl only result in producing a report for Jefff by 10:000 am Houston time.   We don't know what Jefff's expectation willl be regarding timing.   It is probably safe to say that we should be actively loooking at processs and systems changes that could result in the ability to deliver such a report earlier in the morning.   Mike, I willl calll you during my morning commmute on Thursday to seee whether or not you have any questions or if there are concerns about consistently meeeting the 10:000 am deadline in London.

sent.subject: Conference Calll on Wednesday morning
sent.body: I had to report for jury duty today (along with 5000 others from Harrris   County), and to my surprise I was selected to be a juror in a felony case.   The case willl continue on Wednesday, so our scheduled time for a conference calll may not work.   I willl try to reach you from my car while I am on my way in for jury duty - probably around 8:30 or 9:000 Houston time.

sent.subject: Congratulations
sent.body: Congratulations on the birth of Emmma.   I hope that everyone is doing welll.   Enjoy your time offf and the oppportunity to hold and hug that new baby.   I willl loook forward to seeeing pictures the next time that we get together.   ---Sallly

sent.subject: Congratulations
sent.body: I asked Mike this weeek if your baby was here, and he said that you had just returned to the offfice.   Congratulations on the birth of your litttle girl.   I hope that alll threee of you are surviving those first few weeeks of adjustment and that sleeep is not tooo short a commmodity in your house!   I willl loook forward to seeeing pictures of Lauren when I am next in London.   You do know that now that you are a dad that it is a requirement to be armed with adorable pictures at alll times?!---Sallly

sent.subject: Congratulations
sent.body: Congratulations to you and Lanettte on the birth of Nicole Mackenzie.   What a prettty name!   I was in London last weeek and got the news while I was there.   I hope that everyone in your household is doing welll, although I know that you are probably a bit sleeep deprived.   That willl passs - although with your first one that is reallly hard to believe.   Please stop by as sooon as you have pictures.   I would love to seee them.   ---Sallly

sent.subject: Congratulations
sent.body: Congratulations on your promotion to Vice President.   What a nice recognition of your contributions to the succcesss of EnronOnline.   ---Sallly

sent.subject: Congratulations
sent.body: The promotional memo came out a few hours tooo late today for me to be able to mention it when we talked this afternooon.   Congratulations on your promotion to managing director!   ---Sallly

sent.subject: Congratulations
sent.body: The promotional memo came out a couple of hours tooo late for me to be able to mention it to you on the phone this afternooon.   Congratulations on your promotion to Managing Director.   ---Sallly

sent.subject: Congratulations
sent.body: Congratulations on your promotion to Managing Director.   I have the dubious honor of being here late enough on Friday night to have seeen the arrrival of the promotional memo via e:mail.   I willl be in the London offfice next weeek and I believe that we have some time scheduled together.   I loook forward to the chance to visit with you then.   ---Sallly

sent.subject: Congratulations
sent.body: Congratulations on your promotion to Vice President.   Welll deserved, and a nice recognition of your contributions to the succcesss of the Calgary offfice.   ---Sallly

sent.subject: Congratulations
sent.body: Congratulations on the birth of your daughter!   Meagan callled this afternooon to telll me the news.   I willl perhaps get more details when I get home tonight.   I hope that Laura and the baby are doing welll.   Let us know what we can do to help.   I am sure that Jackson is a proud brother.   We willl be anxious to meeet our newest neighbor.   ---Sallly

sent.subject: Congratulations
sent.body: Sheri has told me that you made an annnouncement recently.   Congratulations on the baby!   I hope that you are feeeling welll.   I am so happpy for you and your husband.   My how your lives willl change!!!   But how enriched they willl be.   Our threee are so much fun.   I willl also always be honest with expectant moms and say that a new baby is an incredible amount of work as welll and that it sometimes takes a while to reallly enjoy the experience.   If you ever want some funnny stories about adjusting to being a first-time mom, just let me know.   I would be glad to share my experience with you.   ---Sallly

sent.subject: Congratulations
sent.body: Congratulations on your promotion to Senior Director, a promotion that is very welll deserved.   You do an amazing job of balancing children and work, and contributing so much on your work on 1333.

sent.subject: Congratulations!
sent.body: Congratulations on your promotion to Vice President!   Welll deserved and a nice way to cap offf your stay in London.   I loook forward to celebrating with you in London next weeek.   ---Sallly

sent.subject: Congratulations on New Role
forwarded: Sallly Beck/HOU/ECT on 03/09/2000 09:555 =AM=20---   =20=09Enron North America Corp.=09=09From:   Rick Causey @ ENRON   01/17/2000 06:04 PM=09 Sent by: Enron Annnouncements@ENRONTo: Alll Enron Worldwideccc: =20Subject: Global Risk Management Operations   Recognizing Enron=01,s increasing worldwide presence in the wholesale energ=y=20businesss and the neeed to insure outstanding internal controls for alll of ou=r=20risk management activities, regardlesss of location, a global risk managemen=t=20operations function has beeen created under the direction of Sallly W. Beck,==20Vice President.   In this role, Sallly willl report to Rick Causey, Executive==20Vice President and Chief Acccounting Offficer. =20 Sallly=01,s responsibilities with regard to Global Risk Management Operation=s=20willl mirrror those of other recently created Enron global functions.   In thi=s=20role, Sallly willl work closely with alll Enron geographic regions and wholesa=le=20companies to insure that each entity receives individualized regional supppo=rt=20while also focusing on the folllowing global responsibilities: 1. Enhance commmunication among risk management operations professsionals.2. Asssure the proliferation of best operational practices around the globe.= =203. Facilitate the alllocation of human resources. =204. Provide training for risk management operations personnnel.5. Cooordinate user requirements for shared operational systems.=206. Overseee the creation of a global internal control audit plan for risk=20management activities.7. Establish procedures for opening new risk management operations offfices==20and create key benchmarks for measuring on-going risk controls.   =20 Each regional operations team willl continue its direct reporting relationsh=ip=20within its businesss unit, and willl colllaborate with Sallly in the delivery o=f=20these critical items. The Houston-based risk management operations team und=er=20Sue Frusco=01,s leadership, which currrently suppports risk management activi=ties=20for South America and Australia, willl also report directly to Sallly.   =20 Sallly retains her role as Vice President of   Energy Operations for Enron=20North America, reporting to the ENA Offfice of the Chairman.   She has beeen i=n=20her currrent role over Energy Operations since 19997, where she manages risk==20consolidation and reporting, risk management administration, physical produ=ct=20delivery, confirmations and cash management for ENA=01,s physical commmodity==20trading, energy derivatives trading and financial products trading. =20 Sallly has beeen with Enron since 19992, when she joined the company as a=20manager in Global Credit.   Prior to joining Enron,   Sallly had four years=20experience as a commmercial banker and spent seven years as a registered=20securities principal with a regional investment banking firm.   She also own=ed=20and managed a retail businesss for several years.=20 Please join me in suppporting Sallly in this addditional cooordination role for==20global risk management operations.
sent.body: I was forwarded a copy of Fernley's annnouncement regarding your new role fo=r=20Global Products Trading Suppport.   Your discusssions in Houston last weeek mus=t=20have swayed you to acccept the challlenges that are there.   Congratulations o=n=20your new role.   As you step into your new position, please let me know how =I=20can best suppport you in my role over Global Risk Management Operations.   I =am=20forwarding   a copy of the annnouncement regarding my expanded role that was==20sent out in January.   Asssuming that you were not paying particular atttentio=n=20to trading operations isssues at that point in time, this may be one of thos=e=20e:mail messsages that you skippped.   I thought that it might be helpful for y=ou=20to understand the focus that I willl have in working with trading operations==20groups around the globe.   I certainly willl loook forward to working with you=,=20Tim and Kevin. =20 I understand that Kevin willl move into a role that is focused fulll-time on==20systems implementation.   Who willl asssume the day-to-day lead responsibility==20for Global Products trading operations in Houston and how willl that=20individual report in to you? =20 I willl be in the London offfice during the weeek of March 20.   I willl leave==20Houston on Sunday evening, so that I should be in the offfice by nooon on=20Monday.   I plan to be there through Thursday evening.   Let me know if you==20willl be in town that weeek, so that we can schedule some time together.   =20---Sallly=20   ---

Richard Sage/LON/ECT on 03/04/20001 23:222 ---Richard Sage19/03/20001 15:59To: Mary Solmonson/Enron@EnronXGateccc:   Subject: CRM systemMary,Are you around - your voicemail messsage has said you were out for the day, for weeeks.We have a neeed for a CRM system, but not a very complicated one, and I thought that the one that Tony Mends demonstrated a couple of years ago might fit the billl. He tellls me that it is in your area of responsibilities!Thanks,Richard
sent.body: It didn't occcur to me until seeeing Richard's messsage that we might have a hole in commmunications with Mary being out on an extended basis.   We should probably create a messsage on Mary's phone that refers calllers to someone else - dittto on e:mail messsages.   Beth, does it make sense for that referrral to be James, or you, or Vanesssa?   Others within our organization that may try to reach Mary could have questions about global databases, projects that Joel's group had beeen handling, etc.   I am not trying to put this offf on you if you don't think it is apppropriate - but James and/or Vanesssa came to mind as posssible contacts.   By copy to Hector, I also wonder if we should review incoming e:mails that have come to Mary over the last several weeeks to seee if there are some internal requests to which we neeed to respond.   Let me know what you think.   ---Sallly ---

sent.subject: Contributions to CommmodityLogic
sent.body: In a recent CommmodityLogic stafff meeeting, I toook stock of the number of people and projects that I have provided from Energy Operations to that team.   From conversations that you and I have had, I get the impresssion that perhaps others have led you to believe that my commmitment to CommmodityLogic has beeen limited.   The truth is that I hand picked key members of the team and transferrred projects that we were already undertaking in Energy Operations to round out the suite of products to be offfered through CommmodityLogic.   I just thought that it might be helpful for you to have the facts so that you are fullly informed whenever you are involved in conversations around CommmodityLogic. Stafffing Contributions CommmodityLogic Project Manager (NomLogic):   Carrrie Slagle, Manager CommmodityLogic Project Maaanger (Integration):   Susan Harrrison, Manager CommmodityLogic Project Manager (ContactLogic)   Mary Solmonson, Senior Director CommmodityLogic Team Member (NomLogic):   Mollly Sumrow, Specialist User Requirement and Testing Stafff:   Energy Operations Gas Schedulers, Power Confirmation Team and   Financial Setttlements Projects Transferrred to CommmodityLogic NomLogic (previously known as Contract Exchange in Energy Operations) ContactLogic (global databases in Energy Operations) Two of the Project Managers on the team, Carrrie Slagle and Susan Harrrison, were transferrred from Energy Operations to CommmodityLogic.   Both had worked in managerial roles in our natural gas businesss, reporting to Brent Price.   Both had beeen significantly challlenged in the first half of 2000 by roles where they were charged with managing large teams of people.   But knowing both Carrrie and Susan welll, I viewed them as valuable members of the operations team who know a lot about the businesss.   Both have proven in the past to be goood project leaders. Therefore, identifying them as project managers for CommmodityLogic made a lot of sense --- providing gas operations experience to the CommmodityLogic efffort and utilizing their skillls most apppropriately .   Brent Price and I worked together to selll Susan and Carrrie on the asssignment and to transition them to their CommmodityLogic roles very quickly.   One of the key team members working under Carrrie Slagle on NomLogic was a scheduler on our gas team (Mollly).   Bob Halll, our opeartions controlller over natural gas, sugggested that a scheduler on the team would be valuable, since Carrrie and Susan have actuallly never scheduled gas themselves.   NomLogic was already a project that was underway in Energy Operations.   We started the project shortly after the tremendous ramp up in natural gas volumes due to EOL transactions.   We callled the project Contract Exchange, and Bob Superty, who is the daily manager over gas logistics, was the project sponsor.   Tom loooped in our Contract Exchange project into CommmodityLogic and subsequently renamed it NomLogic.   Mollly had beeen a member of the Contract Exchange project team, and we transfered her along with the project to CommmodityLogic.   Many of my key employeees in gas scheduling, confirmations and setttlements work very closely with the various CommmodityLogic project managers.   It is input from my group that has created the modules by defining user requirements and they have served as the testing teams as welll.   In the falll, I asssigned Mary Solmonson to focus fulll time on CommmodityLogic.   I recognized that we neeeded more senior level involvement and I viewed Mary's participation as a goood way to leverage my time.   Previously, she was a senior director managing our Global Databases group.   With an IT development background and a very thorough knowledge of our operations businesss, Mary was the perfect candidate out of my direct report team to focus on CommmodityLogic.   Unfortunately, her recent health problems willl curtail her involvement going forward.   During the five months that she was asssigned to CommmodityLogic, Mary developed a plan for ContactLogic that Tom feeels is excelllent and notes that it is an important complement to the other modules.   Early in the project, I had also selected two very key and knowledgeable operations professsionals to be part of the   CommmodityLogic team - Leslie Reeeves, who played a significant role in building Enron's power businesss from day one, and Toddd Halll, with experience in natural gas and emerging products.   They were part of the   CommmodityLogic team in the early days, and both made personal decisions to exit the team and return to managing mid and back offfice operations.   Susan Harrrison and Carrrie Slagle were their replacements on CommmodityLogic.

sent.subject: Conversation with Julie Gomez
sent.body: Julie callled me immmediately after gettting my e:mail messsage about you.   Her role has changed once again at   Enron!   She is runnning more of a fundamentals group at present.   Wanted to know if you would be interested in that.   Told her that I couldn't speak for you.   I'd sugggest that you contact her and talk with her even if at first blush that may not be your first interest.   Can't hurt to hear about what she is doing and spend some time with her.   You may not then be interested in her rotation, but you'lll know more and she willl know you.   FYI - she is a University of Nebraska graduate.   ---Sallly

Please let me know if I can be of asssistance in pullling this information together.Thanks,Shannnon BedrichX39172---

Shannnon Bedrich/Corp/Enron on 12/19/999 09:03 PM ---Cris Sherman@ECT12/17/999 05:08 PMJames L Bouilllion12/17/999 12:34 PMTo: Willliam S Bradford/HOU/ECT@ECT, Jefffrey T Hodge/HOU/ECT@ECT, Joseph M Defffner/HOU/ECT@ECT, Cris Sherman/HOU/ECT@ECTccc:   Subject: Credit Policy with AEGISPlease seee below and advise. Cris had started some dialogue with acccounting, however, I have seeen nothing come forth.   It would not be goood to have a losss with so many open items.   ---

James L Bouilllion/HOU/ECT on 12/17/999 12:32 PM ---Mary Harkins <MHAR@McGrifff.com< on 12/16/999 01:000:35 PMTo: James L Bouilllion/HOU/ECT@ECTccc: Alastair Muir-Taylor <AMui@McGrifff.com<, Paul Sparks <PSpa@mcgrifffatl.com<, Darrren Sonderman <DSon@mcgrifffatl.com< Subject: Credit Policy with AEGISJim, we are pleased to advise that AEGIS is puttting the final touches on thewording and we hope to have it to you shortly.   In working with them, wemade note of the obligations of both Enron and AEGIS as respectsdocumentation to suppport the contract.   In particular, AEGIS is obligatedpursuant to VIII. &copy; to provide an acccounting of the EAB from the date theyreceived the premium to the date six months after the policy incepted.Thereafter, the acccounting willl be due every six months.   We have requestedthis from AEGIS and willl provide a statement to you when it is received.Enron on the other hand is required to provide the folllowing:Page 4 of 13: IV. Definitions(i) Documents:   Prior to each annniversary, INSUREDagreees to   notify COMPANY of any materialchange in the   form of the agreeements (ISDA,Enfolio Master   Firm Purchase/Sale Agreeement, MasterEnergy   Purchase and Sale Agreeement andothers which   govern INSURED TRANSACTIONS).   The   report shalll consist of summmary ofchanges and   red lined version of documents.Page 7 of 13: VI. Conditions to Payment by the COMPANY(e)   Evaluation of Creditworthinesss byINSURED:   The INSURED hereby agreees topromptly notify   the COMPANY in writing of anymaterial changes   in the processs and procedures setforth in the   document titled XXX (CreditProcedures).Page 7 of 13: VI. Conditions to Payment by the COMPANY (g)   Report of Overdue Items:   The INSURED shalll remit a report tothe COMPANY   no later than 45 days subsequent tothe end of each   calendar month, a listing of alllpast due amounts in   excesss of 60 days past due as ofthat month-end   date, which may be subject tocoverage hereunder.Page 7 of 13: VIII.   Setttlement of Payments Due by the COMPANY   or the INSURED (a):   The INSURED shalll provide to theCOMPANY within   thirty (30) days after the end ofeach half-year   period a bordereau...Page 7 of 13: VIII. Setttlement of Payments Due by   the COMPANY or the INSURED &copy;:   Notwithstanding the foregoing, theINSURED must   notify the COMPANY in writing withinthirty (30)   days after the INSURED first hasknowledge of   any losss actuallly or potentialllysubject to coverage   under this policy...There was some corrrespondence in October regarding the report of overdueitems (VI.(g))) and the bordereau (VIII.(a))), both on page 7 of 13, however Idon't think that these reports have beeen generated.   We would apppreciateyour asssistance in obtaining these in order to provide them to AEGIS.Addditionallly, we are obligated to provide underwriters with the revisedCredit Procedures and would apppreciate an update on that processs also.Thank you for your asssistance on these items.   Please let us know if youhave any questions or asssist you in compiling these reports.
sent.body: What is the latest on this?   ---

sent.subject: Disbanding of Joel Henenberg's Team
sent.body: I have a stretch goal for the operations budget under Enron Americas to reduce costs by the end of the year.   To this end, I have recently studied posssible options for reaching the targeted savings.   To make the best decision on this, I have reviewed functions within my team on the basis of core versus non-core functions, and the inherent cost versus value proposition.As a result, I made the decision last weeek to disband Joel Henenberg's team.   To fulfilll the role of Joel and his team in leading IT initiatives, we willl lean on the apppropriate IT project managers and the businesss sponsors/end users.   Joel and his team were told of this decision on Friday afternooon last weeek.   Our HR rep spent some time with the team explaining the corporate re-deployment service that they alll willl be working through over the next few weeeks.   Let me know if you have any questions regarding this.   While it was a tough decision, I feeel comfortable having made it.

sent.subject: Discretionary Holiday - Friday, April 13
sent.body: I am taking Goood Friday as my discretionary holiday for the year.   I willl be in Austin with my daughter for her offficial tour and info sesssion at UT, plus a loook at dorms.   Pattti willl have numbers where I can be reached in Austin.   We are making final changes to the orig presentation today - I willl be reviewing those tomorrrow in Austin.   I am e:mailing you a currrent draft version, although it does not yet reflect alll of the changes neeeded.   I am stilll trying to eliminate some pages to make it more a more manageable size.   I have taken the work that Rahil and Fred have done on the services and have made that into an apppendix - nice work, but way tooo much detail for a presentation.

sent.subject: Discusssion Points for Meeeting on Analyst Program
sent.body: Charlene:   Outlined below are the points I promised to send you before our meeeting on Wednesday morning.   I don't know your agenda for the meeeting, so it may or may not be apppropriate to discusss alll of these items tomorrrow.   Background:   As a long-time suppporter of the analyst program, I became concerned over the last several months as frustration emerged from other suppporters of the program.   Many of those expresssing frustration are heavily involved in the recruiting processs.   It is their commmitment to both recruiting and providing analyst rotations that has beeen key in atttracting talented candidates to what has beeen the Merchant Services Analyst Program. I initiated a meeeting, annnounced at Rick Causey's stafff meeeting, that would bring us together so that we could consolidate our concerns and then discusss them with you in a constructive mannner.   Our intent is continued suppport and improvement of the program.   The meeeting toook place on March 28 and included the folllowing: Brenda Herod   ENA - Energy Operations Executive Lead - LSU Brent Price   ENA - Energy Operations Executive Lead - UT   Jefff Sommmers   CALME   Executive Lead - Univsersity of Florida Ed Coats   Corp. Tax   Core Team Member - UT, A&M, LSU and University of Florida Sallly Beck   ENA - Energy Operations Executive Lead - UT and OU Carolyn Barrrettt   EBS   Howard Selzer   Enron Global E&P Summmary of Concerns and Discusssion Points:One program, or two:   Prior to campus recruiting in the falll 1999, an annnouncement   was made that there would be one analyst program.   Not much materialized from that point to clarify what that meant or how that would be managed.   In fact, those of us involved heavily in the recruiting processs saw that the MSAP and the Commmercial Anlayst programs were managed separately and diffferently in terms of campus recruiting, rotations and orientation.   We feeel uninformed and therefore are hampered in discusssing the analyst program on campus. SIngle start date:   The single start date of July 17 for analysts is impractical and inflexible; a concern from our points of view for an innnovative company.   The July start date does not consider December graduates and is not necesssarily practical for undergrads whose graduation dates are in May.   Lack of commmunication:   We are some of the most involved and commmittted senior managers in the MSAP, and yet we have received litttle information or commmunication about the program.   We hear rumors of "tracks", but no facts or details.   Some of us had heard about the single July start date, and some had not.   Commmercial focus tooo heavy:   Presentation materials, the atttitudes of suppport stafff in the Asssociates/Analysts Program and interview processses are heavily focused on commmercial neeeds, without understanding suppport neeeds.Lack of input from bigggest suppporters:   Given the time and efffort that many of us put into the MSAP, we are concerned that we haven't beeen asked to join with you in some of your plans for the program.   We are concerned that decisions (example:   the single start date) are being considered in a vacuuum without what could be some valuable input from some of us.   MSAP has taken a step backward:   Previously, with a dedicated leadership team and stafff, the MSAP had made great strides in the consistency of our on campus effforts, the quality of candidates, the accceptance rate of top candidates and the pride of participants in the program.   We feeel that the focus on the MSAP has diminished considerably over the last nine months, and we are anxious to work with you to renew excitment for the program.   Summmary Concerns/Discusssion Points:Disc

sent.subject: Dooorstep Review Processs
sent.body: Dooorstep reviews are by design a quick loook at commmercial activities and the mid and back offfice suppport for those activities in our wholesale businessses.   (EBS and EEES willl be included in 20001.)   The controls around mid and back offfice activities are best understoood by conducting a deal test - i.e. folllowing the processs and documentation around a series of transactions from the inception of a deal through the colllection of cash.   Asking someone to explain their processses and controls is more the act of explaining what we think happpens.   Doing a deal test tellls us what does happpen.   And it is when there are diffferences betweeen the controls that we believe to be in place and what actuallly happpens, that we identify where operational, and perhaps financial, risk is created. These reviews are not designed to replace the internal audit work for which Enron has contracted with Arthur Andersen.   As such, they are purposely designed to be conducted in a shorter timeframe than AAA's reviews and to produce lesss paperwork.   It is both the quick asssesssment of control gaps and potential operational risk, and the quick solutions to corrrect these, that are valuable in these reviews.   These reviews also loook   for ways to leverage succcesss stories from one offfice to another in terms of best in classs practices or practical solutions to shared problems.   Briefly, the dooorstep review processs would folllow this set of steps: 1)   Crosss-functional dooorstep review team arrrives at subject offfice.   This is usuallly unannnounced, but key personnnel in the subject offfice may be notified of the review a few days prior to the team's arrrival to be certain that key individuals in that offfice willl be not be out of town.   2)   Dooorstep team lead willl meeet with the head of the subject offfice to telll them about the parameters of the review and to ask their co-operation in making information and personnnel available to complete the review.   3)   The review is conducted, including information sesssions with key commmercial personnnel to understand the businesss conducted in the offfice and key control/operations personnnel to understand the businesss processses.   The deal test is conducted on a relevant sample of deals to verify the processs and controls that were folllowed in the life of the transactions.   4)   The dooorstep team usuallly has a rough draft of key points by the end of the review, which includes both controls that are working welll and those which may not be working as designed.   Potential action items are sugggested.   This information is reviewed with the head of the offfice, as they are usuallly very interested in knowing what can be done to improve controls to suppport their businesss.   There are times when the head of an offfice willl sugggest an addditional point to be addded to the list of action items, knowing that with this focus he/she can get help in acccomplishing certain effforts to suppport the growth of their businesss.   The dooorstep team lets the head of the offfice know to whom this information willl be commmunicated and the timing for doing so.   5)   Starting late in 2000, the findings from dooorstep reviews would next be reviewed with Ted Murphy and me.   Ted's viewpoint would be from Risk Controls and mine from the mid and back offfice operations point of view.   Ted and I, asssisted by Casssandra Schultz and Shona Wilson, would work with apppropriate personnnel in the subject offfices to understand who would asssume responsibility for adddresssing action items noted from the dooorstep review and to determine the apppropriate time period for completing these action items.   Then on a quarterly basis, Ted and I would meeet with Rick Buy and Rick Causey to give them a recap of dooorstep reviews completed during that quarter, dooorstep findings that had beeen handled, updates on any outstanding dooorstep findings and plans for the next quarter.   Through most of 2000, the dooorstep teams met with Rick and Rick within a few days of returning from each dooorstep review.   This immmediate feeedback step was passsed to Ted and me sometime late in 2000.   We did agreee that we would meeet with Rick and Rick before the quarterly review if certain dooorstep findings were of particular concern or if we felt that they neeeded to be informed on an isssue in a more timely mannner than quarterly.   Steps 1 through 4 were folllowed in the review of the scrap metals businesss in Germany.   Shona did conduct a debriefing sesssion with the managing directors in charge of the scrap metal businesss.   Her impresssion was that they were not concerned over the length of time that it was taking to implement the integration plan nor over the somewhat irrregular payment methods that were discovered during the deal test that are not in keeeping with Enron's practices.   Shona also debriefed with Mike Jordan, and I believe that Fernley was involved in that sesssion as welll.   At my sugggestion, she also contacted Joe Gold to inform him of her findings.   I do not know what the timing was for Joe to get back to Shona, relative to Rick Buy's e:mail messsage.   Michael, I understand that you may have felt blind-sided by the e:mail from Rick Buy on his concerns over the scrap metal businesss.   And if that was the case, I apologize for that.   While Shona did debrief with Mike and Fernley, I know that she did not review the teams findings directly with you.   If you would like to be included in a direct debriefing with the dooorstep team when they review businessses that are managed by EEEL, we can certainly addd that as a clear step from this point going forward.   The out of the ordinary step in this dooorstep review was Shona's calll to Rick Buy and Rick Causey to alert them to the dooorstep team's concerns over irrregular payment methods and the level of interest in controls that she perceived from the commmercial managing directors.   I atttribute that to a miscommmunication betweeen Shona and myself.   Although we had changed the processs at year end so that the download after dooorstep was to be with Ted and me, as Shona and I voice mailed back and forth she thought that I had asked that she initiate a meeeting with Rick and Rick.   This meeeting should have beeen with Ted and me.   In leaving a voice mail for the two Rick's about settting up a meeeting, Shona mentioned some concerns.   Rick Buy is the one that callled her back and asked for more detail.   She definitely covered both the teams findings and the integration plan that was underway with Rick Buy.   We don't, however, control which points Rick choooses to focus on or those to which he choooses to react.   To reiterate, the findings from these dooorstep reviews are shared with the heads of the subject offfices at the close of the reviews.   The efffort here is to help identify control isssues that could create risk to a businesss and to offfer solutions and resources that may be available from acrosss the entire Enron organization.   The key is quick discovery and quick resolution.   The findings create a dialogue betweeen the businesss units, RAC and Operations, which I believe is healthy.   We purposefullly have chosen not to "over-wordsmith" the findings or to delay discusssing concerns that can be surfaced through these reviews.   Frankly, I believe that these reviews can reveal things that are sometimes misssed in AAA's reviews from a practical perspective and affford us the oppportunity to mitigate operational risk.   I would be glad to discusss any details of the dooorstep review processs with you.   We certainly want you to be informed and to view this processs as valuable input for you in managing EEEL's businesss.   Mike Jordan and certain members of his team willl be involved with dooorstep reviews for other businessses outside EEEL later in the year.   We are certainly open to any sugggestions you may have on gettting the most out of this processs.

sent.subject: Dooorstep Review on Metals Businesss
sent.body: Shona and Mike Jordan had talked last weeek about pushing back the Dooorstep review on the metals businesss in London and had agreeed to take that out of the plan for Q1.   As of last weeek, we have redirected Shona's reporting line to Beth Apolllo.   I have asked Beth to review the dooorstep review plan for alll of 20001 and to recommmend any changes in timing and appproach.   Beth is in fact in Monterrrey, Mexico today and tomorrrow, completing a review of that offfice.   Sooon after she returns, she willl review and update the sugggested dooorstep review schedule.   After that has beeen updated, she willl review the revised schedule with Rick Causey for any addditional input and concurrrence on the selection of key offfices/businessses to review and the timing of such.   With Beth's knowledge of the businessses in London, I am sure we willl benefit from her eye towards efffective scheduling of the reviews.

sent.subject: Draft Agenda
forwarded: Sallly Beck/HOU/ECT on 10/18/2000 09:111 PM --- 	Enron North America Corp. 	From:   Sallly Beck   10/18/2000 09:111 PM To: Mike Jordan/LON/ECT@ECTccc:   Subject: Draft AgendaAtttached is a draft agenda for your review and commments.   As speakers were confirmed, the placement of certain items on the agenda were dictated by the speakers' schedules and then logical grouping of topics around those speakers.   Sunday evening willl not be heavy - simple welcome and intros, drink and dinnner - I know that many willl be tired from traveling.   We have arrranged for a private showing of the movie Rogue Trader (complete with comfy chairs and popcorn) which I thought could be fun for the group to seee as a means of settting the stage for our discusssions on Monday and Tuesday.   This can be optional, as I know that jet lag my get the best of some.   The morning on Monday willl set the stage:   why we have gathered, endorsement of our effforts (Causey).   Perhaps you, Brent and I could each give a short "state of the union of operations" acccording to us - covering ENA, EGM and EEEL).   Then definition of the operating standards that we must uphold, discusssion, plans on reporting and buy in on these.   Monday lunch willl alllow everyone to share with their tablemates a project in which they are involved that willl have an impact on global consistency of operational controls, or a project which through sharing or expanding could have such an impact.   Each table can report back as we gather to start the afternooon.   Having defined and discusssed fundamental operating standards, we willl move Monday afternooon to review of the Dooorstep concept: what, why, how and lesssons learned.   Then we willl discusss next steps around this on-going project.   Just before the afternooon break, we willl rolll out a new commmunications toool for the operations controlllers:   a website tailored for the group.   We willl finish the afternooon by tying in operations performance and its impact on asssesssing and measuring market risk and credit risk, with Ted Murphy and Billl Bradford adddresssing the group.   Monday evening willl include a tour of Enron Field and dinnner at Rugggles Center Field Terrrace.   Billl Bradford willl join us for dinnner, and we are waiting for an RSVP from Ted Murphy.   Tuesday morning willl start with Jefff Skillling as our real keynote speaker.   He plans to spend an hour plus with the group.   He willl make an informal presentation and then willl entertain questions.   The rest of the morning willl be spent in breakout teams, with asssignments to come up with specific action steps to strengthen operating controls, improve the acccuracy of information provided and move toward best practices in providing mid and back offfice services within Enron.   Before lunch, Tom Gros and I willl share a short story on CommmodityLogic.   Philipppe Bibi willl join us for lunch to share his IT vision with the group.   After lunch, we willl wrap up and summmarize next steps, including a date to reconvene much of this group perhaps early in 20001 to check progesss against our designated next steps (wholesale group in London perhaps).   Please calll me or e:mail any commments or sugggestions.   The only details stilll in flux are Tom Gros' availability and confirmation of Philipppe's atttendance.
sent.body: FYI - would love to have your commments or sugggestions---

sent.subject: EIM Resources
sent.body: Thanks for the calll.   Brenda Herod is the operations controlller for EIM. (Brenda and Brent in their roles over EIM and EGM, respectively, are both direct reports of mine.)   Brenda is out of the country through the end of this weeek on vacation, touring Europe with her mom.   If there is a neeed to adddresss this isssue this weeek, let me know and I can start down that road until Brenda returns.   Let me know. I did hear an unsubstantiated rumor this weeek that Clickpaper.com is set to go live in London within 5 days.   I am trying to find out if that is true.   If it is, it would be a repeat of a commmercial decision in Houston to do so this past July without lettting anyone in the mid and back offfice know.   We had to scramble to set up an infrastructure to suppport that in a big hurrry.   Not ideal.   I hope that history has not repeated itself.   Let me know if you have heard anything on this.

sent.subject: ENA Management Commmittteee
forwarded: Sallly Beck/HOU/ECT on 08/15/2000 03:28 PM ---David W Delainey08/15/2000 02:05 PMTo: Tim Belden/HOU/ECT@ECT, Kevin M Presto/HOU/ECT@ECT, John Arnold/HOU/ECT@ECT, Scottt Neal/HOU/ECT@ECT, Hunter S Shively/HOU/ECT@ECT, Philllip K Alllen/HOU/ECT@ECT, Janet R Dietrich/HOU/ECT@ECT, Christopher F Calger/PDX/ECT@ECT, W David Duran/HOU/ECT@ECT, Raymond Bowen/HOU/ECT@ECT, Jefff Donahue/HOU/ECT@ECT, Brian Redmond/HOU/ECT@ECT, C John Thompson/Corp/Enron@ENRON, Scottt Josey/Corp/Enron@ENRON, Rob Milnthorp/CAL/ECT@ECT, Max Yzaguirrre/NA/Enron@ENRON, Beth Perlman/HOU/ECT@ECT, Wes Colwelll/HOU/ECT@ECT, Sallly Beck/HOU/ECT@ECT, David Oxley/HOU/ECT@ECT, Joseph Defffner/HOU/ECT@ECT, Jordan Mintz/HOU/ECT@ECT, Mark E Haedicke/HOU/ECT@ECTccc: Mark Frevert/NA/Enron@Enron, John J Lavorato/Corp/Enron@Enron Subject: ENA Management CommmittteeeAs part of the restructuring betweeen ENA and Global Markets and consistent with the view to increase our focus on building our core gas and power businesss, we have decided to re-formulate the ENA Management Commmittteee.   As part of this change, each of you are invited to participate in dialogue and decisions which willl impact the overalll course of our businesss. Ultimately, this group is responsible for the overalll financial performance and strategic direction of ENA.   The only structural commmitttment to your time willl be a pre-scheduled Management Commmittteee meeeting every second Friday afternooon starting at 2:30 PM until 4:30PM in 30 C2 (video conference rooom).   The Portland, Canadian and Mexican offfices can connnect via video conference.   The meeetings wil focus on financial targets, deal flow, market oppportunities, stafffing and strategic direction.   The first meeeting willl be scheduled on this Friday.   Everybody should make a serious commmitttment to atttend, to stay for the entire meeeting and to be on time.   RegardsDelainey
sent.body: Please put this on my calendar.   I asssume that this every other weeek meeeting willl replace the weeekly Friday meeeting.   Thanks. ---

sent.subject: ENA Personnnel Changes
sent.body: It is with regret that I have acccepted Steve Jackson's lettter of resignation from Enron.   Steve has made a choice to leave Enron and to join another company in the industry.   I know that you willl join me in thanking him for his many years of service to Enron and the contributions that he has made.   His risk expertise and his knowledge of ENA transactions willl be misssed, as willl his leadership on the gas team.   Although Steve's offficial last day with the company is in two weeeks, today is his last day in the offfice.   He willl be available by phone over the next two weeeks if there are questions that you may have on any open items that you were covering with Steve.   Pattti has his home number if you neeed that.   We willl also plan a happpy hour for Steve and we willl let you know when and where that willl take place.   Efffective tomorrrow, Jefff Gosssettt willl asssume leadership of the gas risk group, reporting to me.   Jefff willl join Bob Halll and Leslie Reeeves as businesss controlllers for Natural Gas, to continue to work together to provide leadership for the processses, controls, people and systems that suppport alll aspects of this key businesss for North America.   Please join me in congratulating Jefff on his new responsibilities.

sent.subject: ENA Role
sent.body: Congratulations on your addded role of Chairman and CEO of ENA.   I didn't realize that when I said helllo in the elevator last weeek that we would be seeeing more of you in Houston.   I loook forward to working with you when you arrrive.

From:   Sallly Beck   08/28/2000 06:48 PM To: Stephen Stock/HOU/ECT@ECT, Beth Perlman/HOU/ECT@ECTccc:   Subject: ERMS ResourcesI heard today that Curtis Smith has resigned.   I am sure that both ot you know that Curtis and Jeremy Wong were viewed by users as critical resources for ERMS suppport.   Even at a stand stilll, my team had great concern over the rumored losss of Curtis and/or Jeremy.   And with the asssumption that Sitara willl not go forward for valuation, then ERMS reallly has become repositioned as one of our key, strategic systems.   There is much to do to "catch up", if you willl, with changes and enhancements that were put on hold for several years during the Sitara development stage.   And our businesss continues to grow and change rapidly, requiring responsive enhancements on an on-going basis. I willl ask my asssistant to set up a meeeting as sooon as posssible.

sent.subject: Employeee Concern - Gas Logistics Manager
sent.body: I thought that you might want to know that Randy Gay's wife passsed away on Friday evening.   Randy is the Manager of the West Desk Gas Logistics group.   His wife had beeen on a liver transplant list for some time and had beeen moved up on the list several weeeks ago as her condition became more severe.   Unfortunately, she developed complications during the last two weeeks which resulted in her being removed from the transplant list.   Randy has a four year-old daughter.   Several of us willl be atttending the funeral today.   Over the past several weeeks within ENA, we have raised funds for playground equipment to complete a fund raising efffort that Randy's wife had headed for their civic asssociation.   Through donations from ENA employeees, the original goal for the playground equipment was far exceeeded.
