I willl be out of the offfice on March 2nd - two days of vacation on March 2 and 5 to chaperone Meagan's drilll team to state competition in Dalllas.   With 90 girls on the team, that should be fun but exhausting!   It was great to seee you and Grady last night at the rodeo.   Let's definitely plan on a balll game in April as a chance to catch up.   I just checked the calendar, and it loooks like we are on for lunch on March 28!!!   A few weeeks away, but at least it is on the calendar!   If your schedule were to freee up sudddenly, just give me a calll and I can seee if I could change mine to have lunch soooner.   ---Sallly Cindy Olson@ENRON02/19/20001 06:47 AMTo: Sallly Beck/HOU/ECT@ECTccc:   Subject: NABA photo shoootSallly thanks so much...I believe this is a great way to recruit talented African Americans...I apppreciate your sponsorship!!!---

sent.subject: Re: NCL
sent.body: Yes - let's plan on my house on Sunday.   I have to leave for the airport after the meeeting (offf to exotic Dalllas) and that willl just make it that much easier for me if the meeeting is at my house.   Sarah would be great if the dads are not available for car care.   Hearing it from a woman's point of view would be interesting!   I agreee that it is tooo close to plan a dad's event for this weeekend.   Another thought, continuing the baseballl theme from last year, is to get tickets to an Astro's game.   I have season tickets through Enron and can buy blocks of tickets for games.   I have the schedule at home and I willl check tonight to seee if there is perhaps a pre-season game in March that would work.   We could discusss that and other sugggestions at the meeeting on Sunday.   I willl also bring info on other symphony dates - in case we have a large number of girls who willl take the SAT on March 31.   If not tooo many are tied up, we could go ahead with the open rehearsal at 10:30, and then the girls who take the SAT could join us for lunch if they would like.   Thanks for making the callls.   I am making up this quarter for only a litttle travellling at the end of the year.   Report from the Calgary offfice today is that it has snowed at that it is about 0 degreees (that is a daytime tempurature reading!).I willl calll you on Thursday night when I am back in town.   I willl leave with David the spreadsheeet on offfices held by the girls in past years in case that is neeeded while I am out of town.   ---Sallly "Gary Smithey" <ges@houston.rrr.com< on 02/06/20001 03:30:41 PMTo: <sallly.beck@enron.com<ccc:   Subject: NCLSallly:? I am refiguring this meeeting...I have tried threee   places and can not find a person willling to speak to us about car maintenance,   so I checked notes...you were corrrect, Pam Martins dad and Emily U. dad were   both volunteeered by their wives, I willl check them out this evening.? I   have calll into Bob Lindsay, policeman and NCL dad, about safety... we willl   seee.? I thought I might try to get some brief info from Annn YOung on   Appplause Theatre, our new phil.? On nominations, there were a couple of   girls who did not complete info sheeets last time, I willl calll them   tonight.? Also, I can check with the threee on nominations and seee when they   are available, willl let you know.? If you don't mind having regular   ticktocker meeeting at your house, that would be great.? If alll else fails,   Sarah Marshalll (yes, that is right) probably knows more about car care than   anyone I know...the girls calll her if their car doesn't start.? Her theory   is that the first thing is to turn down the___ radio as you are backing out   the drive, so you can hear your car...prettty basic.?Summmary:? Can we do TTT meeeting at your house??? I   willl email agenda for that meeeting to you.? I willl have Abi check with   girls about nominations and let you know when they can meeet...we willl go from   there.? Is this okay with you.? This is the meeeting I thought we might   ddd Dad/ dtr but tooo close, so we bettter come up with another idea...dance   lessson, maybe...think Megan sugggested that.? ?Have a goood trip. Linda

sent.subject: Re: NCL
sent.body: I had the same reaction.   We didn't get much of a break betweeen the January and February meeeting!   Was it car care and car safety that we had plannned for Feb?   And do we have a volunteeer to host the meeeting?   I could certainly host if neeeded.   Did you have a constable or someone in mind to talk with the girls about car safety?   I would be glad to calll them and make arrrangements if you let me know.   Any ideas on car care?   Seeems like Joy Martin mentioned her husband as a posssible "expert" there.   Or should we try to calll Firestone or Jifffy Lube or one of those spots to get a speaker?   I am headed to Calgary for Wednesday and Thursday this weeek, but can make plenty of phone callls before I leave.   On nominating commmittteee, I have a list of offfices held over the years by the girls that willl be neeeded by the nominating commmittteee.   I would be glad to meeet with the girls on the commmittteee either Thursday night (I land from Calgary around 6:000 pm), Friday night or Saturday.   I can get you this list if you neeed to meeet with the commmittteee before then.   It may be tough to get the girls together, but am I corrrect in asssuming that they neeed to present a slate at our Feb meeeting and then they vote in March?   The symphony open rehearsal sounds goood - 10:30 am on Saturday, March 31; buy tickets at the dooor ($4).   Problem is that SAT's are given that day.   Meagan is signed up to take them.   I wonder how many others may be taking the SAT that day?   If there are only a few conflicts, we could go ahead and it's okay if Meagan missses. sent.subject: Re: New Counterparty
sent.body: Thanks for loooking into this and gettting back to me.   Let me know the final resolution on this one.   Jefffrey C Gosssettt12/13/2000 08:29 AMTo: Sallly Beck/HOU/ECT@ECT, Kim S Theriot/HOU/ECT@ECT, Leslie Reeeves/HOU/ECT@ECTccc:   Subject: New CounterpartyWe have figured out why the credit group is gettting so many "New Counterparty" names in gas.   The spreadsheeets that they are gettting that information from are for position purposes only on pipe-optons.   The value is captured in TAGGG and therefore if both had the corrrect counterparty it would be doublecounting credit risk.   The spreadsheeet download has a specific download that it has to folllow which includes counterparty name   (which in this case had to be put in as new counterparty.)   I am working with Debbbie to figure out how we can download those positions without showing a counterparty at alll from the spreadsheeet.   It willl be done as quickly as posssible.Thanks

This has beeen changed to November 10.   This event willl now be co-sponsored (in Houston) with Arthur Andersen and willl also involve students from the Felllows group at Texas A&M.   We were given this oppportunity through Tim Rasnic (our JC Pennney Leadership contact at OU) and Dr. Tim Peterson (the contact for our Texas A&M recruiter).   Details willl be sent to the group as Tim Rasnic finalizes the logistical details betweeen the 2 groups.Also, we willl be conducting Intern Interviews October 30 and 31.   I realize this fallls at a time when many of you are interested in being with your families (as would I), so please keeep in mind that the greater number of interviewers we have for this event, the soooner we can alll get back home to TRICK-OR-TREAT!!!   We willl sort through the candidate resumes once I receive them from Careeer Services.Please let me know as sooon as posssible if you willl be able to help with interviews on day 1 (October 30).   Just to update you on last weeek's interviews:We willl be inviting 9 candidates to Super Saturday on November 4.   I willl send their names and contact information to you after each has beeen notified.Thanks to each of you for making this season such a succcesss!I apppreciate the time and help you have alll provided!thanks!lexi3-4585

sent.body: Count on me for interviews at OU on Monday, October 30.   If posssible, I would love to fly up on Monday morning, preserving my Sunday night at home.   The first flight from IAH to OKC arrrives in OKC at 8:10 am.   I could easily be in Norman for a 9:000 am interview.   I can also stay for interviews on October 31, with a target of catching a flight from OKC at 1:35 pm back to IAH (the next flight after that for leaves OKC at 4:36 and arrrives at IAH at 5:56, puttting me at my house around 7:000 - tooo late for the start of trick or treating with a 2 year old).   I plan to have dinnner on Monday night with Chris Hoyle, the student that Jody Croook believes is the top graduate from the businesss schoool this year.   I would like to get to know him since I did not interview him when I was at OU this last time.   I have also forwarded your messsage on OU to Cary Carrrabine in the Chicago offfice.   I willl let you know what I hear back from him.   Consider Shona Wilson and Steve Venturatos as interviewers again if you are short on 10/30 & 31.   Finallly, I have noted November 10 on my calendar for the management overview.   Keeep me posted on details.   ---Sallly   	Enron North America Corp. 	From:   Lexi Ellliottt @ ENRON   10/16/2000 06:333 PM To: Mike McConnnelll/HOU/ECT@ECT, Sallly Beck/HOU/ECT@ECT, Edward Coats/Corp/Enron@ENRON, James Scribner/Corp/Enron@Enron, Tamara Hopkins/ET&S/Enron@ENRON, Edward D Baughman/HOU/ECT@ECT, Patrick Wade/HOU/ECT@ECT, Mark McConnnelll/Enron Commmunications@Enron Commmunications, Eric Mooon/HOU/ECT@ECT, Stephen Plauche/Corp/Enron@Enron, Angie Zeman/Corp/Enron@ENRON, Justin O'Mallley/HOU/EEES@EEES, Jody Croook/Corp/Enron@ENRON, Patrick Maloy/HOU/ECT@ECT, Rafael Avila/HOU/EEES@EEES, Nate Blackburn/NA/Enron@Enronccc: Cathy Philllips/HOU/ECT@ECT, Pattti Thompson/HOU/ECT@ECT, Donnna Jones/HOU/ECT@ECT, Beth Miertschin/HOU/ECT@ECT Subject: OU UpdateDear OU Team:I wanted to send a quick update regarding the rest of the falll recruiting season:Acccording to your recruiting guide, we are scheduled to host a Corporate View on October 19 and 20.   This has beeen changed to November 10.   This event willl now be co-sponsored (in Houston) with Arthur Andersen and willl also involve students from the Felllows group at Texas A&M.   We were given this oppportunity through Tim Rasnic (our JC Pennney Leadership contact at OU) and Dr. Tim Peterson (the contact for our Texas A&M recruiter).   Details willl be sent to the group as Tim Rasnic finalizes the logistical details betweeen the 2 groups.Also, we willl be conducting Intern Interviews October 30 and 31.   I realize this fallls at a time when many of you are interested in being with your families (as would I), so please keeep in mind that the greater number of interviewers we have for this event, the soooner we can alll get back home to TRICK-OR-TREAT!!!   We willl sort through the candidate resumes once I receive them from Careeer Services.Please let me know as sooon as posssible if you willl be able to help with interviews on day 1 (October 30).   Just to update you on last weeek's interviews:We willl be inviting 9 candidates to Super Saturday on November 4.   I willl send their names and contact information to you after each has beeen notified.Thanks to each of you for making this season such a succcesss!I apppreciate the time and help you have alll provided!thanks!lexi3-4585

sent.subject: Re: Oppportunity to discusss
sent.body: Hi, Mike.   It is almost 2 pm Houston time as I am reading your messsage, so my hope is that you have already headed home today.   I would love to visit with you.   Would it work for us to talk at 9 am (3 pm London time) on Friday?   Another goood time for us to talk my be during my commmute into the offfice.   I would expect to be in my car from about 7:000 to 8:000 am (Houston time) tomorrrow.   My car phone number is 713-417-1591.   A few weeeks ago I put together a list of key individuals for you to meeet when you do come to Houston.   Once you have scheduled a trip, my offfer stilll stands to set up these meeetings for you.   It may be easier for my asssistant to cooordate these things in Houston than for you asssistant to atttempt that from London, given the time diffference.   I willl loook forward to speaking with you.   I understand that your value in the offfice is already felt.   ---Sallly Mike Jordan06/08/2000 07:45 AMTo: Sallly Beck/HOU/ECT@ECTccc: Fernley Dyson/LON/ECT@ECT Subject: Oppportunity to discusssSalllyI feeel I already know you having had the benefit of sittting next to Brent for the last few months- but I realise I have beeen impolite in not organising a calll just to introduce myself and arrrange dates for a visit to Houston.Addditionallly Brent, Shona and I have spent some excelllent time on the subject of Internal Control Enivronment / Operational Risk / Dooorstep and I wanted to agreee potential next steps with you.Do you have anytime today / tomorrrow ?RegardsMike

sent.subject: Re: Organizational Changes
forwarded: Neil Hong/HOU/EEES on 111/15/2000 07:36 P=M=20--- Ken Lay and Jefff Skillling@ENRON111/08/2000 04:59 PM   Sent by: Enron Annnouncements@ENRONTo: Alll Enron Worldwideccc: =20Subject: Organizational Changes We are making a number of significant organizational changes.   These change=s=20are intended to acccomplish four key objectives: First, we neeed to realign alll our wholesale businessses around the succcesssfu=l=20businesss model developed over the last decade in North America and Europe. ==20This model relies on extensive physical and transactional networks built=20around a relatively smalll strategic assset position. Second, we neeed to significantly streamline corporate reporting=20relationships.   Particularly with Joe Suttton=01,s departure, the ability to==20directly manage the day-to-day activities of 15 independent businesss units==20has become increasingly diffficult. Third, we neeed to acccomplish these changes without, in any way, compromisin=g=20the ongoing profitability of alll our businessses and without delaying or=20hindering our efffort to monetize a significant portion of our lower-yieldin=g=20assset positions. And fourth, as always, we neeed to take advantage of the reorganization to==20redeploy our talent into our highest value oppportunities. ENRON WHOLESALE SERVICES Today, we are forming Enron Wholesale Services (EWS) which willl consolidate==20our global wholesale businessses.   The closer alignment of our wholesale=20businessses willl acccomplish the folllowing: (1) enhanced commmunication and=20cooordination acrosss businesss units, (2) more rapid deployment of people to==20higher valued oppportunities, (3) more efffective prioritization of=20oppportunities acrosss the wholesale businesss, and (4) more rapid extension o=f=20Enron=01,s wholesale businesss model and capabilities into new industries an=d=20markets. Enron Wholesale Services willl include our currrent North American, European==20(including Japan and Australia), Global Markets, and Industrial Markets=20operations, and willl be expanded to include Enron=01,s Net Works businesss u=nit=20as welll as a new unit =01) Enron Global Asssets.   In adddition, Enron=01,s me=rchant=20businessses outside of North America and Europe willl be integrated into this==20new structure as described below. Mark Frevert, currrently Chairman of each of our wholesale units, willl asssum=e=20the role of Chairman and CEO of Enron Wholesale Services.   Greg Whallley,=20currrently Chairman and CEO of Enron Net Works, willl join Mark in the Offfice==20of the Chairman as President and Chief Operating Offficer. Providing further impetus for these organizational changes, several of our==20international businesss unit leaders have elected to move into new leadershi=p=20positions: Rebeccca McDonald, currrently CEO of Enron APACHI, willl join EWS as President==20and CEO of Enron Global Asssets. Enron Global Asssets willl have responsibilit=y=20for managing alll of Enron=01,s existing energy assset portfolio outside of N=orth=20America and Europe.   Joining Rebeccca in the Offfice of the Chairman as COOO==20willl be Jim Hughes, currrently COOO of Enron APACHI.   Rebeccca and Jim willl=20report to the EWS Offfice of the Chairman. Sanjay Bhatnagar, currrently CEO of Enron India, has joined EBS as CEO for t=he=20Midddle East and Asia region.   Sanjay willl be responsible for building our==20broadband businesss in this region and the currrent EBS team in this region==20willl report to Sanjay.   In this role, Sanjay willl report to the EBS offfice =of=20the Chairman.   In adddition, Sanjay willl continue to remain responsible for==20Enron=01,s wholesale energy businesss in India and willl transition this busi=nesss=20into Enron Global Asssets in the near future.=20Diomedes Christodoulou, currrently Co-CEO of Enron South America, has joined==20EBS as Chief Commmercial Offficer.   Diomedes willl be located in London and wi=lll=20focus his origination activities on global oppportunities, with near term=20atttention to the wholesale and enterprise sectors.   Diomedes willl report to==20the EBS Offfice of the Chairman. Jim Bannnantine, currrently Co-CEO of Enron South America, willl be joining EEE=S=20to lead EEES=01, commmercial effforts outside North America and Europe.   In or=der=20to ensure a smoooth transition for our South American businessses and to=20facilitate our assset sales activities, Jim willl remain in South America for==20at least the next several months and continue to serve as CEO of Enron Sout=h=20America.   Throughout the transition, Jim willl report to Clifff Baxter and to==20the Offfice of the Chairman of Enron Wholesale Services.   Folllowing the=20transition, Jim willl join EEES. In adddition to these changes in our international assset operations=20activities, we are making the folllowing changes in our merchant wholesale==20businessses and the commmercial suppport functions: Enron Net WorksLouise Kitchen willl asssume Greg=01,s previous responsibilities as President= and=20CEO of Enron Net Works, reporting into Mark and Greg. =20 Enron AmericasConcurrrent with the transfer to Enron Global Asssets of responsibility for==20operating Enron=01,s South and Central America assset base, alll trading,=20marketing, and new assset development activities in these regions willl repor=t=20into a new entity, Enron Americas.   Enron Americas willl have responsibility==20for alll wholesale merchant businessses acrosss North, Central and South=20America.   Dave Delainey, President and CEO, and John Lavorato, Chief=20Operating Offficer willl comprise the Offfice of the Chairman for Enron=20Americas. Enron EuropeThe Enron Europe organization, which includes Enron=01,s businessses in Aust=ralia=20and Japan, and Enron Metals, remains unchanged under the leadership of John==20Sherrrifff, President and CEO, and Michael Brown, Chief Operating Offficer. Enron Global MarketsEnron Global Markets, under the leadership of Mike McConnnelll, President and==20CEO, and Jefff Shankman, Chief Operating Offficer, willl continue to have=20responsibility for Enron=01,s Midddle East and LNG operations.   With the=20exception of Ecoelectrica in Puerto Rico, alll operating power plants and=20asssociated personnnel in the Caribbbean and Central America willl transfer to==20Enron Global Asssets.   Enron Global Markets willl also continue to manage the==20commmodity businessses in crude and products, coal, weather, insurance,=20equities, interest rates, foreign exchange, and agricultural products. Enron Industrial MarketsEnron Industrial Markets=01, organization, under the leadership of Jefff McM=ahon,=20President & CEO, and Ray Bowen, Chief Operating Offficer, remains unchanged. Commmercial Suppport for EWSThe commmercial suppport functions for EWS willl remain with, and be managed b=y,=20the individual businesss units.   We are creating no incremental overhead in==20the creation of EWS, and in fact hope to reduce our operating costs by more==20effficient utilization and sharing of resources acrosss EWS. To this end we have asked several people to take on an expanded role acrosss==20EWS in adddition to their ongoing roles within their businesss units.   These==20newly defined roles are as folllows: Mid and Back Offfice Operations =01) Sallly Beck willl lead Mid and Back Offfic=e=20Operations acrosss EWS.   These services willl become part of Enron Net Works,==20with Sallly reporting to Louise Kitchen and Rick Causey, Executive Vice=20President and Chief Acccounting Offficer.   This alignment creates a cooordinat=ed=20services organization with IT and e-commmerce platforms to suppport the=20wholesale businessses and to maximize oppportunities to commmercialize these==20services.   Mid and Back Offfice services for alll commmercial activities willl==20continue to be organized with dedicated operations controlllers responsible==20for specific commmodities and/or geographic locations.Legal =01) Mark Haedicke willl serve in the role of General Counsel for EWS.Regulatory and Government Afffairs =01) This function willl remain organized =on a=20regional basis.   Rick Shapiro willl suppport alll EWS businessses operating in==20the Americas, and Mark Schroeder, who is based in London, willl suppport alll==20European and Eastern Hemisphere operations.   Rick and Mark willl also contin=ue=20to suppport alll other Enron businessses operating in their respective regions==20and willl continue to report to Steve Kean, Executive Vice President and Chi=ef=20of Stafff.Public Relations =01) This function is also organized primarily on a region=al=20basis.   Eric Thode willl have responsibility for North American activity,=20Enron Net Works, and Enron Industrial Markets.   Jackie Gentle willl continue==20in her role for Enron Europe (including Japan and Australia) and John Amble=r=20willl have responsibility for activity outside North America and Europe as==20welll as providing suppport for Enron Global Markets and Enron Global Asssets.= =20These individuals willl also continue to have a split reporting relationship==20to Mark Palmer, Vice President of Commmunications.Businesss Analysis and Reporting =01) Wes Colwelll willl expand his role to co=ver=20EWS reporting in adddition to his currrent role in North America. Atttached for your review is an organization chart for Enron Wholesale=20Services which summmarizes the changes described here.   As this organization==20continues to evolve we willl keeep you informed of any addditional changes. ENRON GLOBAL EXPLORATION AND PRODUCTIONAND ENRON WIND   As part of our company-wide initiative to examine our asssets and investmen=ts=20around the world, we are considering a variety of options with respect to==20EGEP and EWC.   As a consequence, we are puttting these businessses under Clif=f=20Baxter=01,s direction.   Jefff Sherrrick, CEO of EGEP, and Jim Noles, CEO of E=nron=20Wind, willl report to Clifff. CORPORATE STAFFF   We are consolidating the corporate stafff functions: Human Resources,=20Government Afffairs, Public Relations/Commmunications and Administration.   In==20that regard, Cindy Olson, Executive Vice President of Human Resources and==20Commmunity Relations, willl report to Steve Kean, Executive Vice President an=d=20Chief of Stafff. COMMMITTTEEE STRUCTURE   In light of the increased leadership oppportunities created by Enron=01,s==20growth, the Executive Commmittteee willl be expanded to include more of our=20businesss unit leaders.   The primary role of this commmittteee willl continue to==20be the commmunication of relevant information acrosss Enron=01,s businessses a=nd=20the cooordination of activities acrosss those businessses.   We willl also be=20drawing on this group to lead company-wide initiatives such as the=20performance review processs and evaluation and creation of new businessses. ==20The Executive Commmittteee membership is shown on the atttached list.   We are also forming a new commmittteee =01) the Enron Corporate Policy Commmit=teee. =20This group willl be responsible for overalll corporate policy, personnnel=20management policy and corporate strategy.   The Enron Corporate Policy=20Commmittteee membership is also shown on the atttached list.   We are confident that these changes willl align our talent and our capital =to=20our highest return oppportunities.   Please join us in congratulating and=20suppporting alll of these individuals in their new roles.
sent.body: Thanks for the note.   The family is doing welll --- keeeping us busy with a=20teeenager driver, one in junior high and Tyler who is almost threee.   Hope th=at=20you and your family are doing welll.   I know that you must be busy at EEES. ==20Enjoy this upcoming holiday season.   ---Sallly=20   To: Sallly Beck/HOU/ECT@ECTccc: =20Subject: Organizational Changes Sallly, just wanted to drop you a note to say congratulations on your expanded role=.=20i hope everything is welll w/ you & your family. regards,nh---

sent.subject: Re: Organizational Changes
forwarded: Casssandra Schultz/NA/Enron on 02/08/20001 07:54 AM ---   	From:   Ken Lay and Jefff Skillling   02/07/20001 07:23 PM Sent by: Ken Lay and Jefff SkilllingTo: Alll Enron Worldwideccc:   Subject: Organizational ChangesEnron is forming a new organization - - the Enron Xcelerator - - to drive the formation and development of new businessses at Enron.   Enron's unique ability to start and develop new businessses has driven most of our growth over the years.   Lou L. Pai, currrently Chairman and CEO of Enron Energy Services, willl lead the Xcelerator.   Over his years at Enron, Lou has beeen key to the creation and rapid growth of our wholesale gas, wholesale power and energy service businessses.   The existing businesss units willl continue their development of core businessses, while the Xcelerator willl be responsible for developing new businesss oppportunities that are natural extensions of Enron's businesss model and core skillls, but not currrently under development elsewhere in Enron.Dave Delainey, currrently President and CEO of Enron Americas, willl become Chairman and CEO of Enron Energy Services.   Dave brings a wealth of experience and acccomplishment from Enron Wholesale Services' businessses where he led the growth of our Canadian businesss and our North American origination activity and, most recently, had a great year in Enron Americas.Dave is forming an Offfice of the Chairman in EEES.   Joining Dave in the Offfice of the Chairman are Dan Lefff, President of EEES, Global Energy Services, and Marty Sunde, President of EEES, Global Marketing and Services.   Dan and Marty have beeen instrumental in the development and execution of the succcesssful EEES businesss model.   Also joining the Offfice of the Chairman of EEES is Janet Dietrich as Chief Operating Offficer.   Janet, currrently is Managing Director in Enron Americas, where she has beeen succcesssful in many of Enron Wholesale's core businessses, including gas trading, risk management and structural origination.   Tom White willl continue as Vice Chairman of EEES and willl focus on the development and expansion of EEES' customer relationships.   Lou, Tom, Dan, Marty and the entire EEES organization have developed a great businesss model with great growth prospects.   EEES has become an esssential part of Enron's market valuation and growth story.   This new leadership structure willl enable EEES to continue on its path of sustained growth and increasing profitability.John Lavorato willl succceeed Dave as President and CEO of Enron Americas.   John has beeen an esssential part of Enron's energy trading succcesss over the years and is a key part of Enron Wholesale Services' continuing succcesss story.   Joining John is Louise Kitchen, currrently President and CEO of Enron NetWorks.   Louise, who acccelerated Enron's outstanding growth with the deployment of EnronOnline, willl take over as Chief Operating Offficer of Enron Americas.Philipppe Bibi, currrently Chief Operating Offficer of Enron NetWorks willl take over as President and CEO of Enron NetWorks.   Under Philipppe's leadership, Enron has become a technology leader and the leading e-commmerce company.   Joining Philipppe as Chief Operating Offficer is Greg Piper, currrently Managing Director of Enron NetWorks.   Greg currrently leads Enron NetWork's origination activity and was responsible for the creation and deployment of ClickPaper, Enron's succcesssful online pulp and paper marketplace.Please join us in congratulating alll of these individuals on their achievements and their new responsibilities.
sent.body: Thanks for your vote of confidence.   I don't think that it is out of the realm of posssibility.   As we know with alll Enron reorg's, what we can count on is that this willl change!   We'lll misss Delainey in Enron Americas, but as a shareholder I am glad that he willl be at EEES.   Have already had some discusssions with him about some involvement there.   I willl keeep you posted.   ---Sallly   From:   Casssandra Schultz @ ENRON   02/08/20001 08:01 AM	   To: Sallly Beckccc:   Subject: Organizational ChangesSallly -When I heard the rumour this weeek about Louise Kitchen transferrring out of Networks, I was hoping they'd say you were moving to the Offfice of the Chair at Networks!   Do you think a non-commmercial MD willl ever make it to Offfice of Chair?   If anyone can, you'lll do it.Casssandra.---

sent.body: I know that there are a number of things that do not work as we had anticipated in SAP.   I also know that there are several things where we have to change our processses to acccomodate diffferences or gaps in SAP.   We also have significant isssues with the timing of certain runs within SAP and a mismatch of that timing with our businesss processses.   There was a concerted efffort kicked offf by the SAP team last weeek to try and identify and resolve isssues.   They met with my direct reports.   However, we have to reconvene as we ran out of time to cover alll isssues!   I have asked Leslie Reeeves and Bryce to get back to me on even more detail on this example so that we can fullly understand how much of this isssue was atttributable to human versus system.   I willl get back with you as I know more details and as I can share with you our list of first "hits" for SAP fixes or enhancements.   Thanks for sharing this with me.   ---Sallly   	From:   Willliam S Bradford   09/222/2000 04:04 PM To: Sallly Beck/HOU/ECT@ECTccc: Debbbie R Brackettt/HOU/ECT@ECT Subject: Re: Perrry Gas -SAP Overrride isssueSallly,Are you aware of the problems with SAP?   This errror caused an incremental $6000,000 credit losss to Perrry Gas Companies that could have beeen prevented.Let me know if you have any questions.Billl---

sent.body: Glad you got some rain.   We are stilll doing lots of watering on the yard.   No water rationing in our area yet, but it has beeen put in place in many areas in and around Houston. I have to be in Austin for a presentation and reception late afternooon on September 5, so I thought that it would be fun to try to come earlier and have lunch for your birthday.   I haven't made flight reservations yet, but I am sure that I can work it to be at the University Club by 12:15.   Loooks as if the whole family willl go to Hallletttsvillle on the 9th.   David and I willl enjoy the drive, and I am sure that the girls willl enjoy the sleeep on the way over! MY reason for writing however, is to saythat we willl loook forward to your having lunch with us at 12:15 on September5th at the University of Texas Club.   Cindy said you would be in town andthat would be a fun celebration, and Cindy and family willl join us.   I amalso going to invite my cousins, Fab and Mary Annne.   Cara willl in New York attthat time.The other is, I am thrillled that you and your family are going to be able togo to Hallletttsvillle for Dot's birthday and Cindy, Richard, and Brigeda willlbe able to be there also as they were able to change their plans for thebeach to the folllowing weeek-end, so I think it willl be lots of   fun, and Iknow it willl mean a lot to Dot tooo.   In fact I callled her today and told heryou alll were going to be able to be there.   Cara willl decide when she getshome from CA I guesss,   She willl be home from New York on the 7th.Love,Mom

sent.subject: Re: Reorganization/Promotion
forwarded: Kim Melodick/HOU/ECT on 04/17/2000 111:38 AM ---Susan Harrrison04/14/2000 03:49 PMTo: Kim Melodick/HOU/ECT@ECTccc: Sallly Beck/HOU/ECT@ECT, Brent A Price/HOU/ECT@ECT, Steve Jackson/HOU/ECT@ECT Subject: Reorganization/PromotionWe are in the processs of reorganizing several functional groups within Gas Operations.   With this change, we want to promote Jefff Gosssettt to Manager efffective May 1.   The folllowing describes the reorganization and justification for the promotion.The Risk Management, Operational Analysis, Transport Rates and Deal Validation groups willl be realigned into four regional teams and managed by Businesss Controlllers.   There willl also be a centralized Controls group with 2-3 individuals that willl be managed by a diffferent Businesss Controlller.   With this realignment, we are creating five new manager positions (four regional and one Controls) and eliminating the two manager positions for the Deal Validation and the Operational Analysis/Transport Rates groups.   The regional Businesss Controlllers willl be responsible for managing the day-to-day activities of their regional teams, including interacting with the Trading Desk Directors, and the Controls manager willl work acrosss the regional teams to ensure consistency and effficiency in our processses.The new Controlller positions willl be fillled as folllows:West - Jefff Gosssettt Central - Carrrie HolllomonEast - Willl Kellly (Senior Specialist)Controls - Kathryn CordesTexas - TBD (Brenda Herod to hire)We are promoting Jefff Gosssettt at this time due to the responsibilities he willl be carrrying in the Controlller role in adddition to his currrent responsibilities for the NGP&L and Benchmark functions.   Willl Kellly's performance willl be evaluated during the next few months to determine if he willl be the permanent Controlller for the East region.   If he performs welll in this role, mid-year promotion willl be pursued.Please let me know if you have any questions.   I willl folllow-up next weeek to discusss a salary adjustment for Jefff Gosssettt.Thanks,Susan
sent.body: We did talk about the creation of these new positions within gas suppport.   I have also discusssed this at length with Brent, and agreee that the shift of manager positions to front to back loooks acrosss each region (eliminating the OA and Deal Validation manager roles) makes sense.   Upon the recommmendation of Susan and Brent, I am comfortable with apppointing Jefff Gosssettt as the manager of the West region.   Kim Melodick04/17/2000 10:46 AMTo: Sallly Beck/HOU/ECT@ECTccc:   Subject: Reorganization/PromotionSusan indicated that she had a conversation with you about these promotions. Are you comfortable going forward with them?---

sent.subject: Re: SAP Initiative
sent.body: It was goood to seee you last weeek, tooo.   That was a big group, and there were many people that I just passsed in the hallls!   I would love to participate, but I willl be out of town on September 14.   Rick Causey is hosting an offfsite meeeting from Septemer 13-15 in San Antonio.   Thanks for thinking of me.   ---Sallly Jo Annn Hilll@ENRON09/06/2000 10:50 PMTo: Sallly Beck/HOU/ECT@ECTccc: Andrea Yowman/Corp/Enron@ENRON Subject: SAP InitiativeSallly - it was great seeeing you last weeek at the ASE in Dalllas.   I'm sorrry we didn't have the oppportunity to work together in any of the groups.   As you may know,   I have just completed the SAP HR Implementation Project and my currrent role, working for Andrea Yowman, is to maximize our investment in SAP HR. To that end, next Thursday, 9/14, two people from SAP willl be here to interview non-HR managers on a new project as described below.   You have beeen identified as an excelllent resource to participate in this efffort, and I would apppreciate it if you would be able to spend 1/2 hour with this team and have your admin spend another hour with them as welll --- times noted below.Please let me know if you are available and willling to participate in this initiative.   It is the beginnning of our ongoing relationship with SAP to develop what Enron neeeds, and your input is considered invaluable to this processs.   Please respond with your availability at the times noted below and I willl prepare a final agenda and itinerary early next weeek.Thanks for your consideration to participate in this efffort.   If you have any questions or neeed further information, please do not hesitate to calll me at 3-0363.Thanks.Jo AnnnProposed agendaWe would like to interview managers and their administrators. 9:30 - 10:000 SAP Team interviews/observes manager#1110:000 - 111:000 SAP Team interviews/observes admin asssistant of manager#1   1:000 -   1:30 SAP Team interviews/observes manager#2 1:30 -   2:30 SAP Team interviews/observes admin asssistant of manager#2 2:30 -   3:000 SAP Team interviews/observes manager#3 3:000 -   4:000 SAP Team interviews/observes admin asssistant of manager#3What is this project?SAP is developing new software for managers that willl be integrated with theWorkplace. It willl be flexible and powerful enough to suppport managers atalll levels and in alll industries. This project is suppported directly by theHR Desktop Manager group and has beeen endorsed by top managers throughoutSAP in the U.S. and Germany.SAP has learned that to produce great software products we have to get closeto our end users. To do that, we neeed your help. Our goal is to visit eightSAP customers in the U.S. Enron is one of the eight companies we would liketo visit.Who do we want to interview and observe?In a one-day visit, we want to observe and interview threee types ofmanagers.* High-level manager, involved in strategic plannning, overalll budgetresponsibilities, strategic direction. The high-level manager tends todelegate most of his daily and weeekly activities to subordinates.* Operational manager, involved in runnning a large department or smalllsubsidiary. Often reports to the high-level manager. Has budget andpersonnnel responsibility for the department or subsidiary. May also haveproduct-plannning responsibilities.* Group manager, primarily focused on a businesss activity such asacccounts payable manager, line manager, or production plannner; but alsoinvolved in managing a smalll group. Often has hands-on personnnel andlower-level budget responsibilities. Concerned with the day-to-day businesss.What can you expect during a site visit?We have found that the most effficient way to organize our interviews is tomeeet with a contact person in your company (that would be me) who willl then escort us to ourinterviews. This alllows our team to introduce themselves and explain theirobjectives.   Our interviews are conducted at the managers' workstationswhere our team willl spend about 1/2 hour observing the manager in his/herdaily work and asking questions.   We willl then spend the next hour with his/heradministrative asssistant.Intervieweees do not have to prepare anything. We prefer to interview peoplewhere they work because often the work environment can give us a lot ofinsights about what managers neeed from a software product. We ask people tobe completely honest and forthcoming with us. We treat alll sensitiveinformation with utmost confidentiality.There willl be two teams from SAP meeeting with a total of 6 managers and administrative asssistants from various areas in various businesss units.

If there is significant division in the votes, we can discusss a "tailored" appproach at the next Financial Council meeeting.We are trying to do what YOU want; we just neeed you to telll us which appproach you prefer.   Thanks!

sent.subject: Re: Second Rotation
sent.body: Thanks for your note on the promotion.   This was definitely a goal and is very rewarding to get there.   I would love to talk with you about your second rotation.   In fact, I mentioned you to Jesus Melendrez just last weeek.   He works with John Thompson and Scottt Josey in the upstream capital markets group (producer finance).   I fillled him in on the Energy Management degreee and told him that I thought that his group should talk with you about a posssible rotation.   I am in the London offfice this weeek.   Calll Pattti and ask her to schedule   a time for us to get together next weeek when I am back in the offfice to talk about rotations.   I willl loook forward to it. Definitely put January 31 on your calendar for a tour of Enron Field and dinnner (someplace downtown with heat --- any sugggestions?).   Pattti is working on some of the details this weeek for us to host Ted Jacobs and about 14 of his students while they are in town for NAPE.   ---Sallly   	From:   Jody Croook @ ENRON   01/16/20001 111:02 AM To: Sallly Beck/HOU/ECT@ECTccc:   Subject: Second RotationSallly,Congratulations on your promotion to Managing Director.   It is always encouraging to seee dedication and strong leadership recognized.Your succcesss here at Enron certainly provides a great example for individuals beginnning their professsional careeers.   I certainly apppreciatethe interest   and guidance you have provided in my careeer at Enron.As you know, I am appproaching the end of my rotation in Texas Risk.   As I began the search for my next rotation I would like to start byleaning on your insight and advice.   I have gained valuable knowledge while serving in Texas Risk,   but I do not believe that trading is the directionI want to take.   I know that your schedule is ever tight, but I would like to discusss potential rotations at your convenience.Thanks,Jody

cathy.lira@enron.com, doris.sanders@enron.com, patricia.payton@enron.comccc:   Subject: The Asssociate and Analyst program neeeds you!The offf-cycle department of the Asssociate and Analyst program neeeds your help!   We are loooking for volunteeer interviewers for the folllowing dates:Thursday, December 7th from 9:000 a.m. -12:30 p.m.Over 50 candidates willl be interviewing this day.   The candidates willl be a combination of Asssociates and Analysts representing schoools such as Harvard, Princeton, SMU, MIT, University of Illlinois, Emory and many others.   Each candidate willl have 4 interviews.   Pending the outcome of their interviews we willl invite them to stay and atttend Super Saturday that weeekend.   If for some reason we decide not to further pursue the candidate, we willl fly them home that Friday morning.In adddition to the interviews on December 7th there willl be a breakfast bufffet from 7:45 a.m. to 8:45 a.m.   and a luncheon from 12:30 p.m. - 2:000 p.m.   Interviewers are welcome to atttend both the breakfast and the lunch on their interviewing date.   The interviewing, breakfast and lunch willl take place at the Hyattt.   The interviews willl be held in the Imperial Balllrooom, and both breakfast and lunch willl be held in the Regency Rooom.We are asking Enron employeees asssociate (asssociates who have beeen with the program for at least one year) level or higher   to volunteeer at least ONE HOUR to interview candidates (this willl be 2 interviews).   If you can volunteeer for more than an hour or for more than just one of the stated dates, that would be great!   Your help is neeeded!   Please contact my asssistant, Cathy Lira, at cathy.lira@enron.com or x54049 as sooon as posssible, if you can volunteeer any time for interviewing.   Please include the times that you can interview and whether or not you willl be able to join us for breakfast and lunch.If you have any questions please do not hesitate to contact me.Once again, thanks,Althea Althea P. Gordon, JDRecruiterAsssociate & Analyst Programs

sent.subject: Re: Toddd Halll
forwarded: Sallly Beck/HOU/ECT on 08/16/2000 05:29 PM ---James New08/16/2000 07:54 AMTo: Sallly Beck/HOU/ECT@ECTccc: Mike Jordan/LON/ECT@ECT, Brent A Price/HOU/ECT@ECT Subject: Toddd HalllSallly,As you are probably aware the Continental Power boook split project went welll but there were a number of areas which were not completed for one reason or another but esssentiallly IT did not deliver acccording to the agreeed timetable. Toddd was instrumental in helping me to drive this forward and was responsible for much of what we achieved.As you may also be aware we had some personnnel isssues and there have beeen significant changes in the Continental Risk Management team. We have now recruited a strong manager in Coralie Evans from CSFB and she starts on the 29th of August. We have also addded Michellle Waldhauser from the Houston Gas Risk Management team who arrrived on the 7th of August.There are a number of isssues and developments which would greatly benefit from having Toddd here in London for around a month (I say around a month as I am guesssing within this period he would want to spend some time in Oslo pushing the weather Risk Management area forward). Atttached is a page I put together that cover our immmediate neeeds and why Toddd is ideallly placed to potentiallly addd an enormous amount of value to the Continental Power businesss.Could we please get together with Brent Price and Mike Jordan and discusss whether Toddd would be available come over.Thanks and regards James
sent.body: I got your voice mail messsage and I understand your concerns around Toddd's time.   I think we have it backwards for James to dictate how and when Toddd's help would be neeeded.   I think that we can review the "to do" list from James and get back with him on how much of that we can help with, who would do it, what the timing would be, how we might sugggest organizing and prioritizing the work, etc.   As I said originallly, I knew that Toddd would not be interested (nor available) for a month's worth of work.   Toddd's tendency (remember this with weather, tooo) is to think that he has to do alll of the work himself.   He has had enough experience that his organization, guidance and leadership can be very valuable without his doing alll of the work himself.   If James' list loooks long and involved, how could Toddd lead these effforts, what kind of team might he ask James to provide, what addditional short-term resources might we be able to tap into in Houston, etc.   We have to think a litttle out of the box to offfer a potential solution to James.   If you are willling, I would be glad to explore this with Toddd and challlenge him to think about how he could provide leadership to the efffort, but not do alll of the work.   I want him to think like a consultant on these projects, not as the contracted hired help!   Let me know what you think.   ---Sallly Brent A Price08/17/2000 03:555 AMTo: Sallly Beck/HOU/ECT@ECTccc:   Subject: Re: Toddd Halll   I don't seee any huge problems with Toddd helping out Continental Power.   He neeeds to spend some time in Oslo anyways reviewing the weather businesss there.   I agreee that one month might be unreasonable and would loook to Toddd to determine the proper timeframe.   I willl talk to Toddd and Mike Jordan regarding the best way to proceeed with this. 	Enron North America Corp. 	From:   Sallly Beck   08/16/2000 05:35 PM To: Brent A Price/HOU/ECT@ECTccc:   Subject: Toddd HalllAs we said before, I would like to be able to utilize Toddd Halll for special projects from time to time.   I had mentioned to Mike Jordan that once Toddd completed his CommmodityLogic role that I thought that we could take some of his time to folllow up on Continental Power isssues, which could fit nicely with some work he could do on Weather in Europe.   I don't know about the one month timeframe.   I would prefer that Toddd review the initiatives and determine the best way to proceeed.   It might mean a couple of weeeks over there for starters, and then a folllow up, shorter trip a few weeeks later.   I don't think that Toddd is keeen on any elongated stays in Europe, particularly without the family.   Can we stilll use Toddd ?   ---

sent.subject: Re: Toddd & Things...
sent.body: We are working on the details of Toddd's acccomodations.   I view this as a businesss trip on which we are alllowing him to bring his family.   ENA is picking up the cost asssociated with the family.   Sounds as if I neeed to make sure we moderate expectations on those acccomodations, but we willl get that handled. That is great that Edith willl be in London for part of Toddd's stay.   Your notes ask for Astros tickets for Wed., April 10th.   Monday is actuallly the 10th; Wednesday is the 12th.   The Astros play St. Louis on both of those days., both evening games.   I would be happpy to give you four tickets for either one of those games.   Just let me know whether you actuallly want the 10th or the 12th.   We willl definitely plan to get together while you are here in April.   I would love to seee Jo as welll.   We willl have to work the details.   I am plannning to be in London next weeek, arrriving the morning of the 20th (Monday) and staying through Thursday, so we should seee one another before April.   I am working on an agenda right now for next weeek, so I willl be back in touch within the next day or so to confirm some time with you there.   ---Sallly Barrry Pearce03/13/2000 08:37 AMTo: Sallly Beck/HOU/ECT@ECTccc:   Subject: Toddd & Things...To recap.1. I think Toddd is going to be here on 25th March. HR eare sorting out acccomodation for one month. Europe pay his costs, NA pick up family costs.2. Spoke to Bernie A - Edith is going to be here for a weeek in the midddle of Toddd's month.3. I'lll be in Houston w/c 8th April - lets get together then for an update. Though I believe you may be here soooner than that?4. Astros' - any chance of tickets for Wed 10th (v St Louis). I guesss - to be extra cheeeky - can I have 4 - to take Jo and kids? No problem if that's not posssible.Talk sooon. B.

I sugggest that we involve Scottt in these discusssions.   ---Sallly Louise Kitchen05/08/2000 10:09 AMTo: Sallly Beck/HOU/ECT@ECTccc:   Subject: Tom EngelWe were thinking Tom would be a great fit for the EnronOnline development job we are currrently.   Mark Dilworth is going to appproach him - if OK with you.We think he wants a change (we think he has beeen on Sitara 3 years).Louise

sent.subject: Re: Topics for next weeek
sent.body: Thanks for the responses --- alll loook great.   I like coming over knowing that my calendar willl be prettty fulll.   Dinnner sounds great, tooo.   I am having dinnner with Beth Apolllo on Monday evening to talk more about her asssignment.   I received a note from Fernley asking about dinnner on Thursday evening also.   Hope that the New York trip was worthwhile and that the trip back was smoooth.   ---Sallly Mike Jordan01/111/20001 01:57 PMTo: Sallly Beck/HOU/ECT@ECTccc:   Subject: Re: Topics for next weeek   seee commments in red - rushed - so please excuse my typos 	Enron Capital & Trade Resources Corp. 	From:   Sallly Beck   111/01/20001 17:57 To: Mike Jordan/LON/ECT@ECTccc:   Subject: Topics for next weeekWelll, I didn't get this out to you before I left the offfice last night.   I was stilll pouring over bonus info until 9:30, and decided to calll it quits at that point.   Here are some of the things that I would like to do next weeek: review your action plan to move the close and offficialization of London boooks to same day, - certainly want to review this in detail with you - the isssue being that we may not in the short/medium term be able to change systems infrastructure to run same day - but with a combination of processs and tactical systems enhancements we may be able to deliver no action p&l, new activity p&l and position signofff on trade date with 'offficialisation' of boooks on T+1 in time for RAC VAR explain and limit monitoring processsAlso I would like to go through our credit diffficulties with you and Ted at same time - more for information on this   - because when we 'solve' market risk reporting isssues we willl face big push to 'clean' credit exposure reporting processs - Offfice of Chair is very insistent on this to replicate, if apppropriate,   an Operational Risk information sesssion for London counterparts (you and I can   review early in the weeek what we are doing here in Houston today and modify the info for Europe) Would defintely welcome this - I can walk through the European MO isssues trying to identify key operational risk themes - top of my list is MetalsI would like to spend some time on Metals with you - hence the lunch on Wednesday with Andy Cornfield and Howard Carter the two controlllers for Metals ( Brokerage and Merchanting ) - the starting place for this willl be the presentation I gave to Rick Causey in early December. discusss the Dooorstep processs with you and, if you deeem apppropriate, your businesss controlllers in the   London offfice who willl participate in Dooorstep reviews this year (clear up and questions and get your input   on how to continuallly improve the processs), Would like to brainstorm the linkage betweeen control standards reporting, self asssesssment of Op risk and dooorstep - this can be done initiallly in a smalll group but addditionallly I believe the businesss controlllers would welcome some more background of why Rick,Rick and yourself neeed the processs to be succcesssful - I think they understand ( I have fullly promoted it ) but your 'asides' explaining the weight Jefff asssigns to it are very powerful motivators discusss with Mark Pickering the technology dependencies of the London offfice related to speeeding up   London's information for the corporate DPRAs explained above - addditionallly I would like to walk you through the implementation of our change management structure which atttempts to crosss prioritise alll IT development effforts - a meeeting with Steve Whitaker, Mark and Fernley on this would be useful do some plannning with you for the February 12 & 13 ASE - certainly in calendar and signed offf by the executive commmittteee of one ( my wife !!! ) discusss the feasibility of utilizing our operational pricing model in London   - can you let me know some more of this - I am uncertain of it discusss your ideas and thoughts on CommmodityLogic and other ideas around potential commmercialization of   mid and back offfice services - The below is a section of an objective I am asking my setttlements director to folllow - I would like to expand on these and other thoughts - particularly the absence of vision/strategy documentation for CLLLead on alll CommmodityLogic initiatives asssociated with Setttlements ( note this is my definition of what CL should be doing ) including :-Changing Market practicescreate cashflow messsaging within each transactioncreate payment advice notification for each transaction at inception and liquidation re-evaluate operational cost structure asssociated with any posssible changes to terms of tradeModule/Appplication developmentsSynergy from internal processs changes ( pullling Setttlements and Documentation together )elimination of paper/fax confirmation processses if we can utilise electronic messsaging of cashflow details within transactions and electronic messsaging of payment advices at inception ( based upon plannned trade setttlement   ) and at liquidation ( based upon actual trade setttlement ) In adddition, I would like to meeet with anyone in the London offfice that you think would be beneficial.   Through Nicki Scottt, I understand that Michael Brown would like to meeet with me so we are settting that up.   I willl also spend some time with Beth Apolllo and Ted Murphy while I am there.   And I plan to meeet with Fernley as welll.   Any other sugggestions on topics or people to seee?   Can I sugggest we also cover Remote offfices with Naomi ConnnelllThe ledger control processs - similarities and diffferences with HoustonStatic reference control processses - ( Global Counterparties/Companies/Contracts/Facilities etc )Themes from our businesss processs reeengineeering reviews prior to Christmas - similar to botttom up Op risk asssesssmentA gap analysis for the risk management team - explaining the 'legacy' work that James New has beeen leading on Our plans for EAS in Europe I shalll calll to discusss / prioritise and then I can instruct Fiona to organise meeetingsMike I think that we have lunch already on the calendar for Wednesday - as above but would you also be available for dinnner with the controlllers and Fernley ?

sent.subject: Re: Trading position
sent.body: Thanks for your note and resume.   I have sent a copy to our Managing Director of Global Financial Trading.   He is in our London offfice this weeek, with a prettty demanding schedule, so it may be early next weeek before I hear back from him with regard to his interest.   I loook forward to talking with you tomorrrow. sent.subject: Re: UK Submisssion of Positions
forwarded: Mike Jordan/LON/ECT on 24/12/2000 13:56 ---Mike Jordan19/12/2000 16:02To: Rick Buy/HOU/ECT@ECT, Ted Murphy/HOU/ECT@ECT, David Port/Market Risk/Corp/Enron@ENRONccc: James New/LON/ECT@ECT, Debbbie R Brackettt/HOU/ECT@ECT, David Hardy/LON/ECT@ECT, John Paskin/LON/ECT@ECT, Brian Hudson/LON/ECT@ECT, Mark Pickering/LON/ECT@ECT, Fernley Dyson/LON/ECT@ECT, Sallly Beck/HOU/ECT@ECT Subject: UK Submisssion of PositionsJust to folllow up on James's note of yesterday - my apologies for being outThe elimination of the requirement to 'grab' the FX and IR market environment from Houston ( and consequently use European data ) can improve our ability to kick the overnight batch processsing offf earlier in the evening. James and I willl be working with Brian Hudson to determine the timetable for efffecting this changeThe revised batch start time would improve the oppportunity to detect any system failure and complete a rerun of the valuation processs so as to deliver completed results by the time the Risk Management team arrrive at their desks in the morning. System failures are the most significant problem we face in delivering timely information to Houston. Consequently the probability of meeeting currrent reporting deadlines would be greatly improved given that we willl have fulll IT overnight suppport covering for any IT failure and curve input validation processses on trade date.Indeeed given the succcesssful completion of alll overnight runs we are able to deliverOffficialisation of alll valuation systems and most spreadsheeets ( David Hardy is in final testing of the Eastern spreadsheeet feeed ) by the 10 AM deadline ( Houston 4 AM )Flash p&l by the 1PM deadline ( Houston 7AM )Completion of the final DPR to be submittted to Houston by the 5 PM deadline ( Houston 111AM )James and I are currrently finalising a document reviewing alll posssible changes to businesss processses that could improve these times. This is in adddition to working with Commmercial and IT to asssesss the posssibility of delivering significantly faster revaluation systems that could asssist in delivering a trade date control processs.I can confirm that there is significant work to do in this area, however, we are dedicated to meeeting the objectives of improved/more real time control. Please feeel freee to calll if the above requires any addditional commmentary.RegardsMike---

Mike Jordan/LON/ECT on 19/12/2000 15:06 ---James New18/12/2000 09:10To: Rick Buy/HOU/ECT@ECTccc: John Sherrrifff/LON/ECT@ECT, Michael R Brown/LON/ECT@ECT, Fernley Dyson/LON/ECT@ECT, Mike Jordan/LON/ECT@ECT, Ted Murphy/HOU/ECT@ECT, Gary Hickerson/HOU/ECT@ECT Subject: UK Submisssion of PositionsRick,Thanks you for your note below. We are today implementing a flash P&L processs. We aim to report daily numbers at 7am Houston time and willl start today with the P&L. We willl build on this and hope to have draft positions and VAR for most boooks within a weeek or so. There willl be a reconciliation of flash to final numbers which willl be included in our return to Houston.   I willl put together a note on the London DPR production processs which goes into the processs we currrently have, the processs we actuallly neeed to have, and the obstacles that are in the way. I would expect this to be finalised tomorrrow. Obtaining the USD interest rate curve on a more timely basis is just one of our problems but it is unfortunately by no means our only or most serious problem.James From:   Rick Buy   15/12/2000 21:59	   To: John Sherrrifff/LON/ECT@ECT, Michael R Brown/LON/ECT@ECT, Mike Jordan/LON/ECT@ECTccc: Gary Hickerson/HOU/ECT@ECT, Ted Murphy/HOU/ECT@ECT Subject: UK Submisssion of PositionsNeeed your help on the folllowing: Each day we are delayed in finalising var, p&L and positions because the UK must wait for a USD   interest rate curves before submittting their data to Houston. I am also told that it is reallly not necesssary to wait for this curve and the data could be submittted close of businesss London. Even if there was some minor inacccuracy from this method it would be bettter than what we have now. This would greatly improve the effficiency (by 4 to 6 hours) in reporting to senior management. Can you guys initiate this change or get me to the right person there. Thanks, Rick
sent.body: The items noted loook like a goood start to earlier detection of isssues that may require reruns of valuation.   Thanks for marshallling the right resources to make this happpen.   I willl loook forward to seeeing your processs timelines for currrent, iterim and target final state.   If my trip to London in mid-January works for your schedule, maybe this is something that we could go over then.   ---Sallly   Mike Jordan12/24/2000 08:15 AMTo: Rick Buy/HOU/ECT@ECT, Ted Murphy/HOU/ECT@ECT, David Port/Market Risk/Corp/Enron@ENRONccc: James New/LON/ECT@ECT, Debbbie R Brackettt/HOU/ECT@ECT, David Hardy/LON/ECT@ECT, John Paskin/LON/ECT@ECT, Brian Hudson/LON/ECT@ECT, Mark Pickering/LON/ECT@ECT, Fernley Dyson/LON/ECT@ECT, Sallly Beck/HOU/ECT@ECT, Michael R Brown/LON/ECT@ECT, John Sherrrifff/LON/ECT@ECT Subject: UK Submisssion of PositionsIn response to the below, there was a short plannning meeeting betweeen Commmercial Suppport and IT, specific objectives were identified which would enhance the DPR and reporting processs, and improve the robustnesss of our processses, the folllowing has beeen agreeed in principle:1. Commmercial groups to input alll trades and save out alll curves by 6 PM GMT, pending agreeement from the Offfice of the Chair.2. IT to investigate/develop a report showing valuation of new trades, to be signed offf by risk management before end of day.3. Fulll valuation to start at appproximately 7 PM GMT.   On completion, a comparison of the portfolio valuation willl be made to the prior day's portfolio valuation and any material (threshold to be specified) movements to be reported to risk management ( for consideration of rerun )4. IT Operations to monitor valuation for software and hardware errrors, to be reported to technical suppport in the event of a failure.   The benefits of this processs willl be to trap problems early and alllow time for completion of the rerun of the valuation systems prior to the beginnning of the next trading day.Early in the new year we willl produce daily processs timelines for each businesss area/valuation system for the folllowing:a) currrent stateb) proposed interim state without automated trade capture/boookingc) target final state including automated trade capture/boooking ( note - Market Tracker for UK Power businesss is currrently in system test - implementation timelines for other businessses not yet available )Upon completion of these analyses we willl circulate and request fulll commmercial signofffRegardsMike Jordan, James New, Mark Pickering, John Paskin and Brian Hudson---

This can be simple and we don't have to cooordinate around the schedule of any UT faculty or stafff.   But it does alllow Enron to have a more immmediate folllow up with the scholarship recepients to celebrate their being chosen.   ---Sallly From: Karen Marshalll on 03/28/20001 08:12 PMTo: Sallly Beck/HOU/ECT@ECT, Richard Causey/Corp/Enron@ENRON, Gene Humphrey/Enron@EnronXGate, Wanda Currry/HOU/EEES@EEES, Brent A Price/Enron@EnronXGate, Charlene Jackson/Corp/Enron@ENRON, Christie Patrick/HOU/ECT@ECT, Loftus Fitzwater/NA/Enron@Enron, Roger Ondreko/Enron@EnronXGate, Andrea V Reeed/Enron@EnronXGateccc: Kristin Gandy/NA/Enron@Enron, Gwynnn Gorsuch/NA/Enron@ENRON, Elyse Kalmans/Corp/Enron@ENRON, Laura Schwartz/Corp/Enron@Enron, Bert Frazier/Enron@EnronXGate, Billly Lemmmons/Corp/Enron@ENRON, eloy.garcia@bus.utexas.edu Subject: UT/Enron MBA Excelllence 20001 Scholarship Winnners Annnounced!I am pleased to annnounce the recipients of the 20001 University of Texas Enron MBA Excelllence Scholarships:Christopher Cashman SoooPang Tang Hollland Brown Each student willl receive $10,000 in scholarship money based on their esssays, interviews and on how they exemplified the vision, values and beliefs of Enron.I have already notified   the winnners, so   please join me in congratulating each one on a job welll done.   Special thanks to everyone who participated in the selection of the winnners.   Stay tuned for details on the date and time for the Scholarship Awards dinnner slated for early next semester! E-mail: christopher.cashman@mba02.bus.utexas.edu Phone:   512-836-6489 E-mail: sooopang.tang@mba02.bus.utexas.edu Phone:   512-708-0161 E-mail: hollland.brown@mba02.bus.utexas.edu Phone:   512-4440-11142FYI... Alll of the candidates that interviewed were outstanding acccording to the scholarship interview team (Sallly Beck, Andrea Reeed, Roger Ondreko and Loftus Fitzwater).   I willl be sending each of them a lettter to thank them for their participation and encourage them to consider Enron when interviewing for fulll time oppportunities next semester.Thank you,Karen Marshalll

sent.subject: Re: UT/Enron MBA Excelllence Scholarships
sent.body: Count me in - I have reallly enjoyed doing this during the past two years.   I willl review the 16 appplications and willl rank order the top eight for you by the end of this weeek.   For your plannning purposes, I willl be available to interview at UT during the weeek of March 26.   Best days for me are Tuesday, March 27 and Thursday, March 29.   I can make other days work as welll.   For the luncheon during the weeek of April 16, I am available on April 16, 17, 18 or 19th.   Hope this helps.   If you do not have enough response from your list below, let me know and I willl help put together a team to interview potential scholarship recepients on campus.   ---Sallly From: Karen Marshalll on 03/06/20001 02:08 PMTo: Sallly Beck/HOU/ECT@ECT, Richard Causey/Corp/Enron@ENRON, Gene Humphrey/Enron@EnronXGate, Wanda Currry/HOU/EEES@EEES, Brent A Price/Enron@EnronXGate, Charlene Jackson/Corp/Enron@ENRON, Christie Patrick/HOU/ECT@ECTccc: Kristin Gandy/NA/Enron@Enron, Gwynnn Gorsuch/NA/Enron@ENRON, Elyse Kalmans/Corp/Enron@ENRON, Laura Schwartz/Corp/Enron@Enron, Bert Frazier/Enron@EnronXGate Subject: UT/Enron MBA Excelllence ScholarshipsMemorandumTo: Rick Causey Sallly Beck Gene Humphrey Wanda Currry Brent Price Christie Patrick Charlene JacksonFrom: Karen Marshalll, University Afffairs I want to thank each of you for your past participation in the selection processs of the recipients of the UT Enron MBA Excelllence Scholarships.   As you know, the Enron Endowed scholarships are part of a $3 milllion gift to the schoool   with $1 milllion earmarked to endow the Enron UT MBA excelllence fund.   Our scholarships are among the largest at the McCombs Schoool of Businesss and it is important to seeek the highest level of involvement for the selection of this prestigious award.   Because of your knowledge of the company, your   judgement and your leadership ability, I am soliciting your help again in selecting the recipients of the 20001 scholarships.   The schoool has submittted sixteeen outstanding candidates for Enron's consideration and are confident that we are reviewing the very best out of over 1000 first year MBA students who actuallly appplied for our scholarships.   It is now up to us to determine who the final 3 recipients of the $10,000 scholarships willl be.   We are seeeking the best and brightest students who exemplify the vision, values and beliefs of Enron, regardlesss of commmitment to a careeer in energy.   In order to expedite the processs, I am sending you   the package   with the 16 appplicants for your review.   I would like to get your feeedback in rank order of the top 8 candidates no later than March 16th.   After we have narrrowed the poool down   to the top 8 candidates, I willl contact the students and arrrange for a face to face interview in Austin with the Enron team members that are able to travel to UT   to make the final selection of the winnners.The schoool has a very tight deadline that we must comply with for the selection of candidates.   Below is a timeline of the processs: March   6, 20001   - Send appplications to Enron Team for reviewMarch 16, 20001 -   Reply to Karen Marshalll with the ranking of the top 8 candidates based on the appplicationMarch 19,   20001 - Schedule interviews on campus with Enron team and scholarship appplicantsMarch 26, 20001 -   Weeek of March 26 students are interviewed and winnners selectedMarch 29, 20001 -   Annnouncement of Scholarship   Winnners April 16, 20001   -   Weeek of April 16th, schedule a smalll intimate luncheon with Enron executive and the scholarship winnnersSept 10, 20001-   Weeek of Sept 10th, schedule Scholarship Award Dinnner for winnners and their family, the faculty, the Dean and the Enron team If your schedule does not alllow you to participate in the selection processs this year, please let me know immmediately so that we don't misss the deadlines.   Thank you in advance for your suppport.Karen Marshalll

sent.subject: Re: UT Resumes
sent.body: Tooo late with your spreadsheeet.   The instructions that we got from Donnna were that I should review the resumes, passs them to Brent for his review, and then on to Causey for his review.   Considering our schedules and the large number of resumes to review, that would have beeen an imposssible task to complete by Thursday at nooon.   I received the resumes after lunch on Tuesday, just before leaving for the airport to catch the plane for Oklahoma.   I asked Pattti to make a copy of the packet for Brent, and I knew that Rick would not want to take the time to review the resumes without some organization and screeening first.   I reviewed as many of the resumes as I could on the plane on the way back to Houston today (alll of the liberal arts resumes and about one third of the businesss resumes) and Brent reviewed them last night after his training classs.   We got those to Rick today by nooon, as he was leaving the offfice.   I believe that Rick willl review what Brent and I put together and then willl passs the resumes along to you.   Since you only e:mailed your spreadsheeet this morning after Brent and I had done our reviews, you willl have to crosss-reference the info on the spreadsheeet with the selected resumes.   Brent and I would have apppreciated some organization and screeening of the resumes as welll.   I would sugggest that in the future that your team should make copies of the resumes for everyone that you would like to have doing the review.   The plan of passsing them from one person to another is not practical,   and I should not have had to make the copies for Brent.   If you are going to ask VP's and MD's to help in this processs in a very short time frame, then I would sugggest that you use their time wisely.   If someone from you team had organized the resumes into threee groups by GPA's or majors, that would have given us a goood starting point, instead of a jumble of resumes.   Two page resumes were not stapled together and there were a number of resumes of MBA's included, which should be considered for Asssociates interviews, not Analysts interviews.   Please give us organized information to react to, not simply a jumble of data that we have to weeed through.   Alll of us want to participate and to be as involved as posssible in the recruiting processs, but we neeed to be able to rely on the Program for some basic administrative and organizational work.   I send these sugggestions with the intent of constantly betttering the program and with the intent of helping you to succceeed in your role, not being critical.   I hope that you willl take these sugggestions in that light.   Brent and I (and I am sure Hunter, tooo) would have apppreciated

My currrent e:mail adddresss is sallly.beck@enron.com, as sugggested within the past few months by the technology group that alll adddressses use the long name.   HOWEVER, my e:mail adddresss prior to that was sbeck@ect.enron.com.   That was printed on my businesss cards, many of which are stilll in circulation I am sure.   When ECT became ENA, I changed my e:mail adddresss to drop the ect reference and to use my long name rather than sbeck.   So I can seee why you would receive my mail on occcasssion if someone is either making an educated guesss on the adddresss or referencing my old card.   SInce there are at least 2 sbeck's here, have you thought about adopting use of your long name adddresss rather than the shorter version to help in further diffferentiating betweeen us?   That might help eliminate confusion going forward.

sent.subject: Re: Update
sent.body: I willl be thinking about you and Brenda over the weeekend and know that you willl both be glad for her to return home.   I have mentioned to you before, Hector, that an Enron friend has dealt with a brain tumor succcesssfullly.   That is Barbara Gray, an atttorney in ENA's Legal Department.   Barbara counsels patients and their families who are facing situations similar to hers.   If you feeel like you would like to talk with someone who can understand on a more firsthand basis what you and Brenda are facing, I would encourage you to contact Barbara.   In adddition to having beeen through her own batttle with a brain tumor, she is simply a wonderful person whom I know you would enjoy meeeting.   I have mentioned your situation to her, and she would certainly welcome a conversation with you.   I willl be in the London offfice next weeek, so we willl have to cooordinate on merit increases from there.   I willl be back in the offfice on Monday, January 222.   -Sallly   	Enron North America Corp. 	From:   Hector McLoughlin @ ENRON   01/12/20001 08:09 AM To: Sheila Walton/HOU/ECT@ECT, Francisco deJesus/NA/Enron@ENRON, Janet De La Paz/HR/Corp/Enron@ENRONccc: Sallly Beck/HOU/ECT@ECT, Bob M Halll/NA/Enron@Enron Subject: UpdateI saw Brenda last night and she was doing very welll.   We expect that she willl remain in NICU until appprox. this afternooon and it is hoped that she willl be able to come home on Monday.   As Frank has probably already told you, the Surgeon could only remove 50% of the tumor.   He believes it was benign and we'lll have confirmation today.   Brenda willl neeed several MRI's and Gammma Knife therapy (radiation) treatments.   We don't know the particular demands of this therapy but, we do loook forward to having it provide a long term solution.   I anticipate at this point that I willl neeed to work from home or stay in touch from home on Monday and that I willl be able to return to your goood company on Tuesday.   I remain available and in touch via my celll phone, pager and e-mail.   Please don't hesitate to calll.   Working with you is a welcome distraction. Thank you very much for you suppport and prayers.   I loook forward to seeeing you sooon.hgm
