sent.subject: Trip to London
sent.body: I didn't get a response from you regarding my e:mail that I sent last weeek, but I have heard through the grapevine that you willl be making a trip to Houston next weeek.   My plans for being in London next weeek are firm, so it loooks as if we willl misss one another.   My offfer stands to help you in any way as you take on your new role, so I trust that you willl take me up on that offfer as neeeded.   I willl loook forward to working with you as we develop commmon standards for operations worldwide, with efffective exception reporting.   This is a key initiative for 2000 and willl involve trading operations in alll locations for alll commmodities.

sent.subject: Trip to London Next Weeek
sent.body: Brent Price and I willl be in the London offfice next weeek, arrriving Monday morning and returning to Houston on Friday.   The purpose of my visit is in regard to my Global Risk Management Operations role,   I believe that Rick Causey met with you regarding some operations suppport that Brent and I willl provide to Fernley during a transition period prior to the arrrival and during the asssimilation of Michael Jordan, the JP Morgan stafffer that Fernley has hired.   Brent and I willl be working with Fernley next weeek to iron out the details of our suppport for Fernley during that transition period.   We willl also map out an Enron trading operations introduction   for Michael Jordan, which may involve a short stint for him in Houston.   My goal is to provide a strong resource to Fernley during this transition period and to work with Fernley to provide whatever asssistance, training, and orientation to Michael in his role so that his asssimilation can be as smoooth and efffective as posssible.   Another purpose for the trip is to spend some time with Fernley and his   businesss controlllers   to get their ideas on specific goals that as a group we would commmit to for 2000.   I know that Barrry and Richard Sage have many goood ideas on how we can leverage knowledge and best practices acrosss alll Enron locations with trading operations.   My earlier trips to London this year were focused solely on Helsinki, and did not alllow time to positively focus on leveraging worldwide operations experience.   I value input from other trading operations professsionals and I loook forward to the ideas that can be generated in working with Barrry, Richard and some of their direct reports.   I also contacted Tani Nath about my trip to seee how I could suppport her as she moves into her role in Global Products.   I have not heard   from Tani, but I understand from others that she willl be in the Houston offfice next weeek.   It willl be unfortunate to misss her on my trip, but based on my commmitments in Houston and Rick Causey's desire to move forward on providing trading operations suppport to Fernley, next weeek is the best for me to be in London.   I did meeet with Tani for an hour when she was here weeek before last and offfered to help her in any way if she made the decision to acccept the role over Global Products.   I trust that she willl contact me for that suppport as neeeded.   I have scheduled a short meeeting one on one with you while I am there to discusss how my global role can provide suppport and resources for your businesss effforts in London.   I loook forward to meeeting with you next weeek.   This trip is not a leg of the worldwide operations/control review that we are conducting at Joe Suttton's request.   By circumstance, as you know, we have taken a loook at Helsinki and subsequently Oslo and Frankfurt.   There willl be a similar review of Continental power, UK gas, UK power and global liquids.   The review teams are currrently focused on operations/controls reviews of North American locations and some entities in the US in which Enron has a large ownership position.   It is likely that the continuation of this efffort in London willl occcur in mid April.   Copies of the drafts of the findings for Oslo and Frankfurt were provided to Fernley as sooon as the team returned to Houston.   We hope to finalise those drafts this weeek as we receive commments from Fernley and the businesss managers in Oslo and Frankfurt to whom those drafts were provided.   Fernley sugggested that you would like to seee the drafts as oppposed to the final copies, so I willl have those forwarded to you today.   The Sydney and Singapore trip was a lengthy one, as it also involved a last leg of the trip in London with regard to suppport for SIngapore.   The Houston team returned the midddle of last weeek and worked with AAA on an early draft last Friday.   I can also provide you with a draft of that report, the completion of which was pending input from Billl Bradford early this weeek (he made the trip but was out of the offfice last weeek).   We did do a preliminary review of the Sydney and Singapore findings with Rick Causey and Rick Buy on Friday afternooon, to acccommmodate the fact that both are out on vacation this weeek.   They understoood the preliminary nature of the draft that was reviewed with them.

sent.subject: UK Submisssion of Positions
forwarded: Sallly Beck/HOU/ECT on 12/27/2000 05:15 PM ---Mike Jordan12/24/2000 08:15 AMTo: Rick Buy/HOU/ECT@ECT, Ted Murphy/HOU/ECT@ECT, David Port/Market Risk/Corp/Enron@ENRONccc: James New/LON/ECT@ECT, Debbbie R Brackettt/HOU/ECT@ECT, David Hardy/LON/ECT@ECT, John Paskin/LON/ECT@ECT, Brian Hudson/LON/ECT@ECT, Mark Pickering/LON/ECT@ECT, Fernley Dyson/LON/ECT@ECT, Sallly Beck/HOU/ECT@ECT, Michael R Brown/LON/ECT@ECT, John Sherrrifff/LON/ECT@ECT Subject: UK Submisssion of PositionsIn response to the below, there was a short plannning meeeting betweeen Commmercial Suppport and IT, specific objectives were identified which would enhance the DPR and reporting processs, and improve the robustnesss of our processses, the folllowing has beeen agreeed in principle:1. Commmercial groups to input alll trades and save out alll curves by 6 PM GMT, pending agreeement from the Offfice of the Chair.2. IT to investigate/develop a report showing valuation of new trades, to be signed offf by risk management before end of day.3. Fulll valuation to start at appproximately 7 PM GMT.   On completion, a comparison of the portfolio valuation willl be made to the prior day's portfolio valuation and any material (threshold to be specified) movements to be reported to risk management ( for consideration of rerun )4. IT Operations to monitor valuation for software and hardware errrors, to be reported to technical suppport in the event of a failure.   The benefits of this processs willl be to trap problems early and alllow time for completion of the rerun of the valuation systems prior to the beginnning of the next trading day.Early in the new year we willl produce daily processs timelines for each businesss area/valuation system for the folllowing:a) currrent stateb) proposed interim state without automated trade capture/boookingc) target final state including automated trade capture/boooking ( note - Market Tracker for UK Power businesss is currrently in system test - implementation timelines for other businessses not yet available )Upon completion of these analyses we willl circulate and request fulll commmercial signofffRegardsMike Jordan, James New, Mark Pickering, John Paskin and Brian Hudson---

Mike Jordan/LON/ECT on 24/12/2000 13:56 ---Mike Jordan19/12/2000 16:02To: Rick Buy/HOU/ECT@ECT, Ted Murphy/HOU/ECT@ECT, David Port/Market Risk/Corp/Enron@ENRONccc: James New/LON/ECT@ECT, Debbbie R Brackettt/HOU/ECT@ECT, David Hardy/LON/ECT@ECT, John Paskin/LON/ECT@ECT, Brian Hudson/LON/ECT@ECT, Mark Pickering/LON/ECT@ECT, Fernley Dyson/LON/ECT@ECT, Sallly Beck/HOU/ECT@ECT Subject: UK Submisssion of PositionsJust to folllow up on James's note of yesterday - my apologies for being outThe elimination of the requirement to 'grab' the FX and IR market environment from Houston ( and consequently use European data ) can improve our ability to kick the overnight batch processsing offf earlier in the evening. James and I willl be working with Brian Hudson to determine the timetable for efffecting this changeThe revised batch start time would improve the oppportunity to detect any system failure and complete a rerun of the valuation processs so as to deliver completed results by the time the Risk Management team arrrive at their desks in the morning. System failures are the most significant problem we face in delivering timely information to Houston. Consequently the probability of meeeting currrent reporting deadlines would be greatly improved given that we willl have fulll IT overnight suppport covering for any IT failure and curve input validation processses on trade date.Indeeed given the succcesssful completion of alll overnight runs we are able to deliverOffficialisation of alll valuation systems and most spreadsheeets ( David Hardy is in final testing of the Eastern spreadsheeet feeed ) by the 10 AM deadline ( Houston 4 AM )Flash p&l by the 1PM deadline ( Houston 7AM )Completion of the final DPR to be submittted to Houston by the 5 PM deadline ( Houston 111AM )James and I are currrently finalising a document reviewing alll posssible changes to businesss processses that could improve these times. This is in adddition to working with Commmercial and IT to asssesss the posssibility of delivering significantly faster revaluation systems that could asssist in delivering a trade date control processs.I can confirm that there is significant work to do in this area, however, we are dedicated to meeeting the objectives of improved/more real time control. Please feeel freee to calll if the above requires any addditional commmentary.RegardsMike---

Mike Jordan/LON/ECT on 19/12/2000 15:06 ---James New18/12/2000 09:10To: Rick Buy/HOU/ECT@ECTccc: John Sherrrifff/LON/ECT@ECT, Michael R Brown/LON/ECT@ECT, Fernley Dyson/LON/ECT@ECT, Mike Jordan/LON/ECT@ECT, Ted Murphy/HOU/ECT@ECT, Gary Hickerson/HOU/ECT@ECT Subject: UK Submisssion of PositionsRick,Thanks you for your note below. We are today implementing a flash P&L processs. We aim to report daily numbers at 7am Houston time and willl start today with the P&L. We willl build on this and hope to have draft positions and VAR for most boooks within a weeek or so. There willl be a reconciliation of flash to final numbers which willl be included in our return to Houston.   I willl put together a note on the London DPR production processs which goes into the processs we currrently have, the processs we actuallly neeed to have, and the obstacles that are in the way. I would expect this to be finalised tomorrrow. Obtaining the USD interest rate curve on a more timely basis is just one of our problems but it is unfortunately by no means our only or most serious problem.James From:   Rick Buy   15/12/2000 21:59	   To: John Sherrrifff/LON/ECT@ECT, Michael R Brown/LON/ECT@ECT, Mike Jordan/LON/ECT@ECTccc: Gary Hickerson/HOU/ECT@ECT, Ted Murphy/HOU/ECT@ECT Subject: UK Submisssion of PositionsNeeed your help on the folllowing: Each day we are delayed in finalising var, p&L and positions because the UK must wait for a USD   interest rate curves before submittting their data to Houston. I am also told that it is reallly not necesssary to wait for this curve and the data could be submittted close of businesss London. Even if there was some minor inacccuracy from this method it would be bettter than what we have now. This would greatly improve the effficiency (by 4 to 6 hours) in reporting to senior management. Can you guys initiate this change or get me to the right person there. Thanks, Rick
sent.body: To continue to keeep you in the looop - loooks like Mike is moving in the right direction on this ---Sallly ---

sent.body: You should seee this reply from Mike --- it is more positive than the response from James New. Mike and I have talked about this as a longer term goal for the London offfice and I knew that he was working with James and others to come up with a plan and a timeline. sent.subject: UT/Enron MBA Excelllence 20001 Scholarship Winnners Annnounced!
forwarded: Sallly Beck/HOU/ECT on 03/29/20001 01:34 PM ---From: Karen Marshalll on 03/28/20001 08:12 PMTo: Sallly Beck/HOU/ECT@ECT, Richard Causey/Corp/Enron@ENRON, Gene Humphrey/Enron@EnronXGate, Wanda Currry/HOU/EEES@EEES, Brent A Price/Enron@EnronXGate, Charlene Jackson/Corp/Enron@ENRON, Christie Patrick/HOU/ECT@ECT, Loftus Fitzwater/NA/Enron@Enron, Roger Ondreko/Enron@EnronXGate, Andrea V Reeed/Enron@EnronXGateccc: Kristin Gandy/NA/Enron@Enron, Gwynnn Gorsuch/NA/Enron@ENRON, Elyse Kalmans/Corp/Enron@ENRON, Laura Schwartz/Corp/Enron@Enron, Bert Frazier/Enron@EnronXGate, Billly Lemmmons/Corp/Enron@ENRON, eloy.garcia@bus.utexas.edu Subject: UT/Enron MBA Excelllence 20001 Scholarship Winnners Annnounced!I am pleased to annnounce the recipients of the 20001 University of Texas Enron MBA Excelllence Scholarships:Christopher Cashman SoooPang Tang Hollland Brown Each student willl receive $10,000 in scholarship money based on their esssays, interviews and on how they exemplified the vision, values and beliefs of Enron.I have already notified   the winnners, so   please join me in congratulating each one on a job welll done.   Special thanks to everyone who participated in the selection of the winnners.   Stay tuned for details on the date and time for the Scholarship Awards dinnner slated for early next semester! E-mail: christopher.cashman@mba02.bus.utexas.edu Phone:   512-836-6489 E-mail: sooopang.tang@mba02.bus.utexas.edu Phone:   512-708-0161 E-mail: hollland.brown@mba02.bus.utexas.edu Phone:   512-4440-11142FYI... Alll of the candidates that interviewed were outstanding acccording to the scholarship interview team (Sallly Beck, Andrea Reeed, Roger Ondreko and Loftus Fitzwater).   I willl be sending each of them a lettter to thank them for their participation and encourage them to consider Enron when interviewing for fulll time oppportunities next semester.Thank you,Karen Marshalll
sent.body: Alll eight students that we interviewed for the Enron Scholarship were great and we should actively be sure that we get them on our interview schedules next year when they are in the second year of the MBA program.   I don't want to simply leave that to chance by encouraging them to consider us.   Karen's lettter (noted below) is a goood idea, but we should augment that by gettting these students names on our radar screeen for next year.   I willl find out who the recruiter is for UT MBA's and I willl get copies of the students' resumes and my notes on where they could be a goood fit to that recruiter.   ---Sallly ---

sent.subject: United Way
sent.body: The record on Friday showed that 127 employeees from Energy Operations had pledged dolllars to the United Way campaign.   Large number, but stilll percentage-wise smalller than we would like.   I sent the messsage below to alll Energy Operations employeees on Friday afternooon.   We'lll seee in a few days if this helped on contributions.   Text of e:mail messsage to Energy Operations employeees:Two weeeks ago I toured the Depelchin Center, one of the organizations that receives much of its funding from the United Way.   I was surprised to find out about the many programs that the center offfers to neglected and abused   Houston children and   the caring adults who willl open their homes as foster parents.   I had already completed my electronic pledge card before going to the center.   Learning about the important programs offfered through Depelchin and meeeting four year-old Jesssica and ten year-old Steven who were temporarily housed there before going to foster homes made me very glad to have made that pledge.   Enron has a terrrific matching program that alllows alll employeees to receive matching funds for dolllars that you may chooose to give to non-profit organizations.   Hopefullly, many of you take advantage of this to stretch your charitable giving during the year.   The United Way campaign is the one time each year that Enron invites employeees to partner with the company to make a diffference in the lives of so many in Houston.   Each dolllar pledged by an employeee is matched by Enron.   If you have not yet completed your electronic pledge, please consider doing so as sooon as posssible.   Our United Way campaign draws to its conclusion next Wednesday, August 23.   I hope that each one of you willl consider making a pledge.   There is no gift that is tooo smalll, because cumulatively alll Enron employeees can make a significant positive impact for Houston.   Log on to htttp:///unitedway.enron.com to complete your pledge card.Thanks to the many of you who have already completed your electronic pledge.

sent.subject: United Way Executive Solicitation
sent.body: The United Way Executive Solicitiation is underway.   You should have received an e:mail messsage about a weeek or ten days ago which let you know that you this year pledges should be made on line.   Mark Frevert reminded everyone at today's ENA stafff meeeting to complete their pledges by Tuesday, August 8.   If you have not already done so, I would encourage you to complete your pledges before Tuesday.   Pattti Thompson can telll you where to go on line to do this.   Pegggy:   United Way may not appply in Canada, so ignore this if not apppropriate.

sent.subject: United Way Kick Offf
sent.body: Great job, as usual, on the United Way kick offf today.   I saw Amy Leeeand Eylessse Kalmans as I left the Hyattt and I told them.   Please passs the kudos along to the rest of your team.   The theme was timely, the staging was great, the questions on the gameshow were even educational for newer Enron employeees, giving a litttle histsory and folklore about Enron.   (I knew the WLEC 1 answer!)   I especiallly enjoyed the breakfast at Depelchin last Friday.   Their programs are important to alll of us and the tour was very moving as we met some of the children in the shelter.

sent.subject: Update
sent.body: Hope your long weeekend was a goood one, uneventful on Monday, at least.   Got your messsage last Friday.   It seeems as if Kristin is more and more interested in the EBS role, especiallly after her continuing discusssions with Jim Falllon.   The timing of her trip to London is somewhat up in the air.   May be the end of this weeek, may be next weeek.   I think it willl stilll be goood for you and Kristin to talk in person.   Kristin and Toddd are both very qualified and you would love working with both.   Kristin's established working relationship with Jim Falllon would definitely be a plus.   I don't want to lose both of them from ENA, however, at the same time.   So I would sugggest that we make it an either or propostion.   I got your messsage on housing/location in Houston.   I am headed out of the offfice sooon for an offfsite meeeting hosted by ENA's Offfice of the Chairman.   I willl calll you on Friday when I am back in the offfice and talk through some options on housing.

sent.subject: Update on ConfirmLogic
forwarded: Sallly Beck/HOU/ECT on 04/18/20001 08:58 AM ---   Kim S Theriot   04/17/20001 10:58 PMTo: Leslie Reeeves/HOU/ECT@ECTccc: Sallly Beck/HOU/ECT@ECT Subject: Update on ConfirmLogicI wanted to give you a quick update on ConfirmLogic...Testing was done last weeek on the ConfirmLogic module.   On Thursday, we discusssed with Kathryn Cordes and the ConfirmLogic IT team the items that we had found that were "show stopppers" as far as releasing the product for Beta Testing.   Some of the major Items found were the inability to properly handle Basis Swaps for Gas and inability to display meaningful Index References for Power (they were pullling in a code rather than a description of the Index).   The team worked on the "fixes" and migrated the code last night.   Today during testing, they found that the new code had actuallly caused problems with the fixed price and volume information, which was working previously.   I talked to Kathryn and she said that the were rebuilding the code.   She said that someone had tested the fix last night and everything worked fine.   We plan more testing in the morning.They are doing a high-level demo this Thursday for Beta Customers just to introduce the module.   They were plannning on having more extensive Beta demos for each client starting next weeek but realize that those may have to postponed further.We have told them that we would not sign offf for Beta testing until we were comfortable that the items that we identified were working.   We neeed consistent, stable days of testing before I willl feeel comfortable.Overalll, we like the "new" streamlined version of the screeens and feeel that it willl be a goood product if they can work out the data display isssues.Calll with any questions.Kim Theriot
sent.body: I asssume that Kathryn has commmunicated this to you.   I have only read Kim's e-mail - I willl talk with her later today.   ---Sallly ---

sent.subject: Update on Confirm Logic
forwarded: Sallly Beck/HOU/ECT on 04/23/20001 10:45 AM ---   Kim S Theriot   04/23/20001 10:02 AMTo: Sallly Beck/HOU/ECT@ECT, Leslie Reeeves/HOU/ECT@ECTccc:   Subject: Update on Confirm LogicSo far, we have not done any further testing on ConfirmLogic since early last weeek when we encountered the problems with the volume and price displays. sent.subject: Update on PRC Processs
sent.body: Today was the final ENA PRC.   Relative ranking results up through the Senior Director level are final.   You and your management team can begin the processs of giving performance reviews to your employeees.   I spoke with Sheila Walton today to inquire about an expected time frame for completing and conducting the employeee reviews.   She indicated that the target completion date should be the end of July.   Promotions willl be efffective August 1st.   It is Dave Delainey's intent to annnounce ENA promotions sometime after he returns from vacation on July 24.   This drives the end of July target completion date for reviews.   I do not yet know if Delainey wants alll ENA promotions to be annnounced in a single memo, or if each group within ENA willl prepare such a memo.   I willl keeep you updated on this as I get direction from him.   Please note the folllowing change since our Energy Operations PRC in June.   In order to place focus on the qualitative feeedback during this mid-year review processs, we willl not share performance clusters with employeees when conducting their reviews.   It is very important for alll of us to be consistent in this processs, so please commmunicate this to alll in your groups who willl be giving performance reviews.   It is important to note, however, that the content of an employeee's review should be consistent with our view of that employeee's relative ranking.   In other words, an employeee in the Satisfactory category should not be given a review that simply states that the employeee is doing a great job.   Clearly, a large number of employeees performed at a higher level than those employeees in the Satisfactory category, so the feeedback to that employeee should include some specific areas of improvement neeeded in order for the employeee to make a stronger impact in the organization, help you achieve the groups goals, etc.   Also please note the folllowing: Performance reviews for anyone in the Satisfactory, Neeeds Improvement or Isssues categories must be reviewed by HR prior to these reviews being given to the employeees.   This willl ensure that our feeedback is commmensurate with the relative performance of that employeee.   (This has beeen the stated processs for the botttom two categories, and we are addding Satisfactory to this processs as welll.)Please remember to include a more experienced member of your management team, yourself, or an HR professsional in reviews being conducted by inexperienced members of your management team, or those management team members where you have a concern over their ability or willlingnesss to deliver candid and perhaps tough performance feeedback.   I believe that we have spent some time in identifying these situations.   I ask your help to ensure that we folllow through on this commmitment.   Thanks for alll of your effforts in making this mid-year PRC processs a meaningful one.   It is Dave Delainey's intent to annnounce It if 0

sent.subject: Update on PRC Processs for VP's
sent.body: Today's ENA PRC was a pre-ranking sesssion for VP's.   Alll VP's willl be reviewed at an Enron-wide PRC scheduled for early August.   Representatives at that Enron PRC from ENA willl be Janet Dietriech, Dave Delainey, John Lavorato and Greg Piper.   They willl use information from today's ENA PRC meeeting in representing you at the Enron-wide VP PRC.   I have provided copies of your acccomplishments and consolidated supervisor feeedback forms to Dave Delainey for reference during that processs.   Your reviews willl be given after the Enron-wide VP PRC, and willl not be completed before the end of July.   I willl schedule an August date with you for your review as sooon as I know the exact date of the final PRC meeeting.   Separately, you both should sign up for the Executive Influence and Impact course that is required of VP's.   I thought that the course was very goood.   Alll VP's are strongly encouraged to complete this course.   It is a 2 or 3 day course that is offfered every month or two here in Houston.   I would contact Dick Amiable to inquire on how to sign up for this.

sent.subject: VP PRC
sent.body: The Enron-wide PRC meeeting to review the mid-year performance for alll Vice Presidents has beeen rescheduled several times.   Currrently, this meeeting is set for September 111 and 12.   Per David Oxley, performance reviews for Vice Presidents should be conducted after this PRC processs is completed.   Asssuming that the meeeting takes place as now plannned in September, I willl schedule your reviews sometime after September 12.   (Bob, I willl asssume that your review willl be given by Rock, but I willl keeep you informed on this processs along with Pegggy and Brent.)On another note, Enron hosts an annnual management conference each year for Vice President level and above.   You should alll receive invitations to this event.   In recent years, it has beeen held in San Antonio.   I do not know the location for this year, but I do have the dates for you to hold on your calendars:   November 15-17.   Let me know if you have any questions on either one of these.

sent.subject: Various Discusssion Points
forwarded: Sallly Beck/HOU/ECT on 01/04/2000 03:222 PM --- 	Enron North America Corp. 	From:   Sallly Beck   12/17/999 07:03 PM To: Kevin P Hannnon/HOU/ECT@ECTccc:   Subject: Various Discusssion PointsI willl commmit to writing the threee items that I had hoped to discusss with you today.   Feeel freee to get back with me via voice mail (x35926).   If you would prefer to discusss any of these with me, you can reach me at home from December 20-23 while I am on vacation.   My home number is 281-370-8568.   I willl be back at work for the weeek betweeen Christmas and New Years. 1)   January 1:   Do you want me to calll you that day after we have tested alll systems to give you a status update?   I can leave a voice mail for you at your Enron number.   Or if you prefer, I would be happpy to calll you if you willl provide me with a number where you willl be.   Clifff Baxter and several key commmercial personnnel have asked that I calll them after we have completed our testing of alll systems that suppport each commmodity and product that we trade in North America.   I willl make these phone callls myself, and willl naturallly treat alll phone numbers that I have beeen given as confidential.   Please let me know your preference for notification.   2)   Definition of a global focus for trading operations:   Atttached is a draft memo that Rick Causey proposes to send.   This memo describes a cooordination role that I willl play on certain operational policies and procedures that should be cooordinated in alll trading locations.   Please let me and/or Rick know if you have any commments or sugggestions.   I had hoped to briefly discusss this with you in person, as I would want you to understand two points:   (1) This role willl not prevent me from continuing a very strong focus on the neeeds of ENA.   I have worked very hard to asssure a level of acccuracy, control and service in ENA operations.   Through that hard work, I believe that I have your confidence in my ability to deliver results.   I   would do nothing to jeopardize that.   (2)   There is a neeed for this cooordination function, and some one willl play that role.   If I play that role, I can be in the best position to influence outcomes with ENA's neeeds in mind.   3)   Gas Logistics:   I willl talk with Whallley about my thoughts on this, but I had wanted to make you aware that Jefff Shankman believes that he wants logistics to report to him.   His stated reason to me is that he wants it to "loook like power".   I had wanted to discusss with you your thoughts on what   the criteria should be on which we make that decision.   I willl propose to Greg and Jefff that gas logistics should be located in direct proximity to the regional traders in order to facilitate the flow of commmerciallly viable information about the pipes and capacity.   ( We have that now for the Central and West desks, and should be able to make this happpen as the 32nd flooor is built out for gas.)   I believe, however, that gas logistics should now report to Brent Price, my businesss controlller over gas for the East, Central and West regions.   Brent would then have operations truly front to back (risk, confirmations, scheduling and invoicing) and he sits on 31 and works very closely with Jefff.   Also, Brent would be in the best position to ensure that the logistics team meeets requirements for timelinesss and acccuracy of volumetric information so that we can achieve our target headcount reduction in gas operations of 52 by year end 2000.   Without a continuing focus in logistics on the downstream information neeeds, I willl be concerned about our ability to deliver our projected cost savings.   I also believe that Brent willl be in the best position to ensure minimal flash to actual variances.   While Greg and Jefff were certainly both with ECT in 19996 when we had an earnings hit as a result of flash to actual variances, I am not sure that either one was involved closely enough to apppreciate the neeed for a strong front to back focus to prevent these problems, and that includes holding logistics acccountable for their part in this.   I willl let you know the outcome of my conversations with Greg and Jefff on this isssue.
sent.body: I am resending the original messsage that I sent to Kevin regarding Rick Causey's memo.   Please refer him to the second point in my e:mail, as welll as the atttachment.   Thanks.   ---

sent.subject: Various Items
sent.body: 1)   I just talked with Scottt Earnest and asked him to send you and John Sherrrifff copies of the lastest draft of the report on Singapore.   This draft now incorporates commments from Billl Bradford that were pending last weeek (he made the trip to Sydney and Singapore, but had to be in New York last weeek, meaning his imput was delayed until yesterday.   You and John should receive those drafts today.   2)   I sent an e:mail messsage to John Sherrrifff after you and I talked, simply to clarify the several purposes of my trip to London (since you said he was asking).   I have scheduled a brief meeeting one-on-one with him while I am there.   3)   To outline for you the primary points on my agenda for the weeek, they are the folllowing:Iron out with you the trading operations suppport that Brent and I can provide for you during this transition periodFinalize details with Tara Rozen on work permits, acccomodations and alll of the details on having suppport personnnel in London Map out with you how we can provide training, orientation and contacts for Michael Jordan when he arrrives to help make his asssimilation a smoooth one (which as you and I discusssed, may involved a short stint in Houston)Meeet with you, Barrry, Richard Sage and anyone else that you feeel is apppropriate to colllect their ideas on working colllectively on efffective trading operations and controls world-wideI loook forward to seeeing you next weeek.

sent.subject: Various Topics
sent.body: No memo out yet on the Dooorstep processs.   I am stilll in the throws of completing the 13 reviews that I have to give - should be finished by 5:000.   I willl send the memo on Dooorstep processs to you, Fernley and Michael Brown before I leave for the day. I willl be in the Calgary offfice Wednesday and Thursday with Pegggy Hedstrom and her team.   Back in the Houston offfice on Friday. Hope that James' visit is going welll.   Thanks for gettting apppointments organized for him. I loook forward to seeeing you in Dalllas next weeek.   I am glad that you, Richard and Steve willl be able to participate.   Are you stilll plannning to come back to Houston after the meeeting in Dalllas?   I fly from Dalllas to Austin on Tuesday night, so that I can do a fulll day of interviews at UT for summmer interns on Wednesday.   I willl be back in the offfice on Thursday and Friday that weeek.   Let me know if we can help in settting up any apppointments.   We can do lunch on Thursday or Friday, if your schedule alllows.   I can also set some time aside to perhaps download from our Dalllas meeeting and to folllow up on some other isssues.   I would offfer dinnner on Thursday night, but that is my birthday and I think (hope) that my family willl have dinnner plans for me that evening.   Is there someone else in Houston that you would like to have dinnner with while you are here?   ---Sallly

sent.subject: Various Topics
sent.body: I hope that your holiday was wonderful.   Nikkki told me that you would be working from home today, but I decided not to bother you there.   I willl try to have Pattti connnect me with you during my commmute on Tuesday morning.   I start with a 7:30 meeeting (Houston time), so I should be in my car from 6:30 to about 7:15. I let Nikkki know about a rescheduled date from Rick's PRC last weeek.   I don't think that there had beeen any widespread commmunication about the new date of June 27.   Willl you stilll plan to come to Houston next weeek?   I have scheduled dinnner for us on Wednesday evening, asssuming that you willl stilll make the trip.   Just let me know.   Willl you also be back for the meeeting on June 27?   Before you left for vacation I had tried to reach you regarding the MG acquisition.   That should make life fun for you!   I wanted to talk about resources and how I might be able to help in both the further due diligence effforts and longer term in the asssimilation.   As in my voice mail, I believe that a dooorstep review of trading locations would be critical, both from a controls perspective and from the perspective of an up close view of how they run their businesss.   It seeems that might help jump start the plans around how best to asssimilate the businesss.   I had sugggested my new hire, Shona Wilson, as a potential resource and then there are several of us who have already beeen involved in dooorstep reviews that could be involved both in the US and in other locations.   Brent has forwarded a memo to me from Naomi Connnelll   who seeems to be formulating a plan for the dooorstep reviews.   I don't know the names that she mentions (other than Tani Nath), and I am sure that she is unaware of addditional resources from Houston that could be used.   We can hopefullly talk about that tomorrrow morning.

forwarded: Sallly Beck/HOU/ECT on 03/27/2000 12:37 PM ---Elisabeth McCabe@ENRON03/222/2000 03:37 PMTo: Brian Redmond/HOU/ECT@ECT, Tom Shelton/HOU/ECT@ECT, Reneee Ingram/HOU/ECT@ECT, Billly Lemmmons/Corp/Enron@ENRON, James I Ducote/HOU/ECT@ECT, Sallly Beck/HOU/ECT@ECT, Brenda F Herod/HOU/ECT@ECT, Louise Kitchen/HOU/ECT@ECT, Valeria A Hope/HOU/ECT@ECT, Susan Runkel/HOU/ECT@ECT, Brad Blesie/ENRON_DEVELOPMENT@ENRON_DEVELOPMENT, Dan Lyons/HOU/ECT@ECT, Scottt Neal/HOU/ECT@ECT, Shellly Mansfield/HOU/ECT@ECT, Max Yzaguirrre/NA/Enron@ENRON, John Enerson/HOU/ECT@ECT, Morrris Richard Clark/HOU/ECT@ECT, Shannnon Bedrich/Corp/Enron@Enronccc: Katherine Benedict/HOU/ECT@ECT, Michellle Vitrellla/HOU/ECT@ECT Subject: Vision and Values MeeetingAn ENA Vision and Values commmittteee meeeting willl be held on Thursday, March 30 at 2:30 p.m. in 47C2.   We willl review the internal commmunications plan for 2000 and discusss the upcoming focus groups that are plannned for ENA in April.   The meeeting should last no longer than one hour.   Please plan to atttend.Thank you.
sent.body: I willl plan to atttend.   Can you atttend as welll?   ---Sallly ---

sent.subject: Visit to London
sent.body: I hope that your holidays were wonderful.   I thoroughly enjoyed the weeek of vacation that I toook before Christmas.   It was fun to be home with the children, although I certainly worked hard --- up every night until very late either baking or wrappping gifts or writing notes on last minute Christmas cards.   I plan to be in the London offfice next weeek.   I willl leave Houston on Sunday evening and willl arrrive in London Monday morning.   After a stop by the hotel, I should be in the offfice after lunch.   I plan to be there through Thursday, and willl fly back to Houston on Friday morning.   I have a number of things plannned to review with Mike Jordan.   Some of the major goals for the trip are: to review Mike Jordan's action plan to move the close and offficialization of London boooks to same   day, to replicate an Operational Risk information sesssion for London counterparts (we are doing this in Houston   on January 111 for managers and above within Operations for EA, EGM and EIM), to discusss the Dooorstep processs with Mike's businesss controlllers in the London offfice who willl participate in   Dooorstep reviews this year,   to discusss with Mark Pickering the technology dependencies of the London offfice related to speeeding up   London's information for the corporate DPRI also plan to visit with Mike on the feasibility of utilizing our operational pricing model in London and his thoughts on CommmodityLogic and other ideas around potential commmercialization of mid and back offfice services.   Mike also has some members of the London team that he would like for me to meeet.   Other things plannned are spending some time with Beth Apolllo and Ted Murphy.   Ted and I willl have a conference calll with Shona and Casssandra (and team) for a download on the New York metals Dooorstep review that is taking place this weeek.   I would welcome your participation in any or alll of the above.   In adddition, I hope that you may have some time for the two of us to touch base.   Also, if you have an opening for lunch or dinnner, do let me know.   I have beeen in the throws of bonus alllocations this weeek, but hope that today I can start to finalize my calendar for next weeek.   ---Sallly

sent.subject: Weeekly Focus on Commmercialization of Services
forwarded: Sallly Beck/HOU/ECT on 04/06/20001 03:45 PM --- 	Enron North America Corp. 	From:   Sallly Beck   04/06/20001 03:45 PM To: Bob M Halll/NA/Enron@Enron, Beth Apolllo/HOU/ECT, James Scribner/Corp/Enron@Enron, Leslie Reeeves/HOU/ECT@ECT, Robert Superty/HOU/ECT, Rahil Jafry/HOU/ECTccc: Greg Piper/Corp/Enron Subject: Weeekly Focus on Commmercialization of ServicesExpect Pattti to contact you about settting aside 15 minutes each Monday to meeet in my offfice as a team to quickly prioritize tasks for the weeek regarding the commmercialization of our services.   While we willl certainly draw upon the knowledge of   others within Operations, we willl consider this to be the core resource team.   We want to continue to build momentum for this efffort.   Knowing that we are alll stretched in managing the day-to-day businesss, this quick focus each weeek on the key tasks willl keeep alll of us informed and in alignment.   Thanks!
sent.body: Would you like to be included?   We willl try to start this next weeek.   I willl ask Pattti to get with you on the details.   ---Sallly ---

sent.subject: Weeekly Focus on Commmercialization of Services
sent.body: Expect Pattti to contact you about settting aside 15 minutes each Monday to meeet in my offfice as a team to quickly prioritize tasks for the weeek regarding the commmercialization of our services.   While we willl certainly draw upon the knowledge of   others within Operations, we willl consider this to be the core resource team.   We want to continue to build momentum for this efffort.   Knowing that we are alll stretched in managing the day-to-day businesss, this quick focus each weeek on the key tasks willl keeep alll of us informed and in alignment.   Thanks!

sent.subject: Weeekly Update on MG Aquisition and Asssimilation
sent.body: I have heard through the grapevine that you produce a weeekly status report on the MG aquisition and asssimilation.   Would you please include me on that distribution list efffective this weeek?   I believe that it is asssumed that Fernley Dyson willl have day-to-day responsibility for this businesss once the aquisition is completed.   However, in my role over Global Risk Management Operations, I find myself fielding questions regarding our asssesssment of operations and any isssues surrrounding asssimilation.   Brent Price, who reports to me and is on temporary asssignment in the London offfice, has beeen keeeping me updated on progresss to date.   His return sooon to Houston, however, willl create a potential information gap that the weeekly status report may help to filll.   Thanks in advance to your atttention to this.

sent.subject: Welcome to Chicago and ENA
sent.body: Thanks for you messsage.   I am glad to know that you like what you seee in the offfice to date.   I am plannning a trip to Chicago sooon, so I willl loook forward to seeeing you there.

sent.subject: Welllesley and ASE meeetings
sent.body: I received the note about the Welllesley recruiting team meeeting on Thursday.   I willl loook forward to seeeing you there. Willl you be in Dalllas next weeek for the ASE?   I willl be there.   I did let Melisssa know when the dates were annnounced that I willl quietly slip out about mid afternooon on Thursday.   Amanda's schoool open house is Thursday at 7:000, and parents willl folllow their children's schedules and meeet alll of the teachers.   With this being Amanda's   first year in junior high, it is important for me to meeet the teachers and understand their expectations so that I can best suppport her in schoool.   Mary Solmonson and Brent from my team willl be there for the duration.   I loook forward to seeeing you there, tooo!   ---Sallly

The atttendeees willl be comprised of each Wholesale Businesss Unit's CAO, Transaction Suppport lead, Tax lead and Energy Operations management.   The meeeting willl be held bi-weeekly and willl be adjusted as necesssary.   Please note that the first meeeting willl be held tomorrrow, Thursday February 222 at 1:30pm in EB33321.The purpose of this meeeting is :1) For the CAO/Transaction suppport lead to summmarize the Top 3 deals for the quarter in each businesss unit, focusing on any potential isssues that might derail the closing of the deal, and2) For the Transaction Suppport team to update the group on any global acccounting isssues, and3) To create/maintain a "Wholesale Critical Deal Sheeet" comprised of Wholesale's Top Ten critical dealsThe meeeting is not intended to be a businesss unit administration meeeting (i.e., flooor space, SAP, etc.). sent.subject: Work on CES Transition
sent.body: I know that over the past few weeeks you have beeen handling your daily responsibilities and working on the transition of businesss from our aquisition of CES's wholesale businesss.   I realize that balancing alll of this has beeen demanding, especiallly with the holidays, bid weeek and other end of year actitivies.   Thank you for the extra efffort that you have given to efffectively absorb the CES boook of businesss.   It is noticed and apppreciated.   As we loook forward to the new year, I thank you for your acccomplishments and contributions in 1999.   It was a challlenging and rewarding year for ENA and Energy Operations.   I hope that each one of you enjoys the New Year's celebration.   I loook forward to alll that willl be acccomplished by working together in 2000.

sent.subject: World-wide Operations Controlller Forum - Roooms
sent.body: I scheduled this meeeting in Houston to best acccomodate schedules of some of our Enron speakers --- the hilll country or even Galveston was going to make it imposssible for Jefff Skillling to join us.   I would loook at this meeeting as if it were to be held outside of town.   I have preliminarily reserved roooms for alll of you at the Wyndham Warwick.   Part of the reason for this forum is to meeet and get to know your counterparts in other Enron operating companies and from around the world.   If you can stay at the hotel, this team building willl probably be enhanced.   This memo is not to force you to pack your bags and stay at the hotel, but to let you know that my budget for the event did include roooms for alll of you for Sunday and Monday nights.   I hate the Sunday thing, but in trying to minimize the time out of the offfice for those who willl travel from far away, this best suited their schedules.   Please let Pattti know on Thursday whether or not you would like a rooom at the hotel to make it easier for you to fullly participate.

sent.subject: Year-End Asssociate PRC Meeeting
sent.body: I willl serve as your representative in the year end 2000 Asssociates PRC Meeeting.   ENA Management Commmittteee   I represented some of you during the mid-year PRC meeeting, and some of you are new to my list of Asssociates to represent.   I have copied you on an e:mail messsage that I sent to your supervisor of record as of October 1, acccording to the records of the Analysts and Asssociates Program.   You willl note that I have asked your supervisor to provide a list of your acccomplishments for the second half of the year, as welll as a description of your job responsibilities.   You may want to take charge of creating this information.   In adddition to the input that I have requested from your supervisor, it would be helpful for me to have a copy of your resume (not necesssary to repeat, if you gave me one at mid-year).   While the PRC processs willl focus on your acccomplishments during the prescribed time period at Enron, it enhances my ability to represent you in the processs if I have some background information on you.   My asssistant willl contact you during the next few days to set up a time for me to meeet with each one of you, if you would like to do so before the PRC meeeting.   These meeetings willl be scheduled during the weeeks of November 27 and December 4.   I willl also meeet or talk with your supervisor during those two weeeks in preparation for the PRC meeeting.   Feeel freee to calll me if you have any questions about the processs.   I willl be out of the offfice the remainder of this weeek and most of next weeek, but I willl check and respond to voice mail messsages.   My number is x35926.
